zMEsY0dt2zrzmIuIb06TmQ.text: The best BBQ chicken salad that I have ever had. Patio seating was very nice. Service was great. Loved the variety of items on the menu. Definitely recommend this hidden gem.

G2tB16snA9b4WmwvMwbg8g.text: Absolutely the best cuisine and ambiance in Charlotte.  Wait staff are highly trained and very professional.  The meals were prepared fresh, served hot, and the flavors were delicious.  Not as expensive as other restaurants.  Will definitely go back!!  Cannot wait :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent wine list!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love love love this restaurant!

QO-eHhy_XjNfCKHV55SnRQ.text: I absolutely love this place. It's our date night go to, even though I pig out on ribs the make sure to give you a hot towel to clean yourself up. Their lobster bisque is amazingly flavorful. My boyfriend loves there Caesar salad to start and is always switching it up and is never disappointed. And to finish we can't resist that warm delicious cookie

4mLE5eW9wwOdU-hzzLv60Q.text: I have a lot of friends that rave about Bricktop's and I had never been, so recently when I found myself in SouthPark around lunch time, I decided to meet a friend there.  I was worried because there were a lot of people milling around the hostess stand when I arrived.  However, I was able to get a table right away.   I ordered the Ahi Tuna salad which consisted of seared rare Ahi tuna, mixed greens, red onion, fresh mango and a citrus vinaigrette. At $17 for lunch, this is not a cheap salad, but it was good.    Our service was fine on this visit, and while I doubt I would go out of my way to come here frequently, I would certainly eat here again if I happened to be in the neighborhood.

eoVYb3VMrDwWK4O93LWUeQ.text: This is my go too, kick ass service at the bar, not a huge menu, but all the items kick ass

e-zshtuYdSjqul0DQDEfMA.text: Ate dinner here tonight. The wait was minimal for a Saturday night and the hostess kept us updated on our seating. Once seated or server came almost immediately. She was very attentive and helpful with menu questions. We had two apps, tempura shrimp and firecracker sushi roll. Wifey got fish tacos and I had the ribs. Both dishes were excellent! We sat outside which is set up very nicely. The menu prices are not cheap but the food is very good. Will definitely go back. Oh......the fries that come with the Ribs OMG!! AAA+.

tTsq0ThnbY3gQManaQjVzg.text: First time customer. I had the pan seared tuna and veggies. It was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend. Most definitely going to be a favorite place to eat.

jSYKLnhqT2ROpd_josp7Vw.text: It's upscale yet approachable. The presentation of the food wins you over as soon as it gets to your table, but the taste seals the deal. The flavor deal. I hear you have to try the bread pudding; that's next on my to-eat list. I was too full for dessert this time around!

Xp2D7AS-fCxjHZpYwe3aiA.text: I have nothing bad say about my experience here. But did I think the whole experience was worth the $130 for 2? Not really. I had the filet mignon, it was PERFECTLY cooked, (md. rare) and a great glass of wine, but I'll look for some place else when we visit Charlotte again.

vPfwAnhRXv1ImNpcBDF02g.text: I really enjoy coming to this place.  I have been for brunch and dinner.  Service was always good and quick.  The food never disappoints.  I look forward to coming back again very soon.

qi6gMeHyvrw2Fjn8Xj46ZA.text: This review is 100% based on 2 separate interactions with bartender, Mike. I hope the owners are aware of what a gem they have in this employee and treat him accordingly. After living in Charlotte for a couple years there are only a couple standouts and I'm grateful to have found Bricktop's and met Mike. Spent an amazing afternoon on Christmas Day most recently (thank you for being like the only place open) and it was a pleasure to feel at home because of Mike. Will definitely be back to see him!

hu6zDupZ6my2LUPj9DtB4w.text: Lovely. Late dinner while in town for business.  We had dinner at the bar and the serving was attentive and helpful with beer and food suggestions.  Upscale dining. I enjoyed my salmon and cheesy cauliflower. Dan had the ribs and enjoyed. We heard, later, this eatery is known for their ribs. Great grapefruit cocktail with rosemary?  We'd be back if in town again.

tajiHV7KKRAsG78Q3_SpLw.text: I LOVE this place and have for years! It is my go to place for martinis always along with amazing food! Go see Troy, he is the bartender that can take care of of you!

GJgjs8hUjrkmTWhu4u-1gw.text: Seems to be a popular place with business types so is popular around lunch time, but when you sit down the staff will be extremely friendly and skilled. I got the steak and fries and was very good, albeit not quite as hot as I'd like but not cold. If they have the twice baked potato I'd recommend it as it is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Steak and fries&#34; with twice baked potato instead of fries (lunch)

geP6IyvPLHCjZAdFfCHdwA.text: Always consistent, never disappointed. Loved the flat bread pizzas. Crabtini was excellent. Good service, good place for a business lunch.

Xgq0qgKPO9dK4fLmtzkLJQ.text: My new favorite place! The guacamole was amazing and so were the ribs, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach. The deviled eggs were good but not my favorite. The candied bacon paired well with the eggs, a nice touch.

RFSRXZ_9bd8qULLN9zcKJg.text: First of all this place has amazing food. We come here all the time with our entire family. We eat big and spend big including the tips. Beautiful set up ad and decor. Waitstaff can go from awesome and excellent to obviously doesn't want to be here. The hostess are the real issue they run on a power trip. You're a hostess, not the front door to Studio54. They can be very rude and unaccommodating to babies. Please get better hostesses (all of them) and then we can move up the stars.

nqmgL63ReOz1CWLo9AdQCQ.text: Their waffles are excellent. I'm not sure what they do- perhaps Crack- but they were the best waffles ever.   The only reason for three stars is the lack of brunch options. This man cannot live on waffles alone- even epically awesome waffles.

h7Lklji3xQJP7k3D8Axecw.text: Service was great! Nice atmosphere. The blue cheese dressing was to die for! My friend was staring at my salad while I ate. Menu looked to be seasonal. The Chicken Milanese was juicy and crusted with Parmesan. The beurre blanc (sp) was nice and light. Would definitely go back again!

Fk4OAGUWDotGp5biuxTAeQ.text: Great dinner st Bricktops tonight!  Even more amazing than the food was the scene we witnessed.  There was a gentleman at the bar who had clearly had too much to drink.  The staff at Bricktops swung into action led by Katarina, the bartender and totally supported by the entire staff. They repeatedly, and respectfully, asked him if he was driving...volunteering to call a cab.  He said he was walking, but they followed him out to the parking lot to make sure.  When it appeared he was looking for his car, they convinced him to come back in. They called s cab and put him safely inside.  Patron is safe and Charlotte drivers are safe.  Heard them say their GM is in the hospital. No worries, your restaurant is in excellent hands.  And we will be back.

TE626H5tIxenRo5DRP7T6g.text: Friends rave about this establishment; we decided on a lark to go for a late lunch last week and wish we'd diverted to other eateries.   For starters, the wait staff was perhaps the most singularly unwelcoming crowd we have experienced in the city. Considering the upscale ambiance and the number of servers on hand versus the number of customers, waiting five or more minutes for someone to greet us and take a drink order is a little much. Furthermore, both of us also had, more than once, empty drink glasses for more than a few minutes during our meal. See previous comment.  We were situated near the kitchen, so I got the delightful view of our server chatting with another server while holding our drinks a few feet away from us. Our presence seemed at best to be an afterthought.   The food was acceptable but nothing exceptional; I have had far tastier meals for less money and better service at nearby Rooster's. The lobster in my lobster roll was bland, lacking the rich goodness that should make that sandwich so tasty, and the cole slaw was fundamentally sliced cabbage with mayo with a little sugar thrown in for good measure. Even the locally produced ice cream was scarcely discernible as peanut butter pie, its purported flavor.  My husband's french fries were good. That much we can say.  Overall, the restaurant reminded us of country club dining: overpriced mainstream and bland offerings amidst a homogeneous clientele. It was the Wonder Bread of upscale Charlotte dining, and in my many years of Charlotte living I can promise you better choices are literally down the block from Bricktop's.

XbW-RF2a9HlXdSt4Ro2bOg.text: Came and tried the oysters ...  horrible.  Weren't even cold ...  having said that the food itself , main menu, is good.  Service was good too, but don't have the oysters... and at 3 bucks a piece, not cheap.  Friends felt the same

hJPrkjbQCW3wauDKlueKjA.text: My boss took me here today for lunch. I'm definitely coming back with my husband. The ambience and service were excellent. OMG! The deviled eggs and bacon!!! Delish!! I ordered the Palm Beach salad. It was huge! Lump crab meat, shrimp, avocado...all of my favorites. My boss ordered the skillet cookie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream- heaven! Definitely returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Palm Beach salad. Yum!!

k2-reOhJfapMyVmy82ATHg.text: I went with a group of 8. We were seated quickly. The wait staff was superb. Although the place was full, it was quiet enough that we could hear each other. I had the fish tacos.  They were excellent...the best I ever have had!  I am adding this place into my rotation of go to restaurants!

DIv4K4bIh7lr7W2fTYk1Ew.text: The firecracker sushi rolls were delicious! I also ordered the Palm Beach Salad. Loved it. Service is good. Could improve.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Palm Beach Salad was excellent. You can&#39;t go wrong the the combination of these ingredients.
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ahi tuna salad
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Qh8h4Xo5fdR6F5R9Q0dWhw.text: This has become our family go to.  They do a fabulous trout, love the crab cakes and the fries are the best in the city- thin and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  They even grind their own meat for the burgers.   The kids menu offers salmon instead of only offering unhealthy stuff like chicken nuggets and hot dogs. When I come with friends we sit at the bar and enjoy excellent cocktails and with the kids we sit outside and play games with our kids.   They can run around in the courtyard while we have a cocktail.  Its a little disappointing that we are there constantly and no one has ever recognized us, I like it when restaurants recognize and welcome their regulars.  But for the most part its a great cozy favorite for our family!

o6rskZiqJgG9XQwVb45ltQ.text: Enjoyed fresh sea bass and sauteed spinach after a delicious Caesar salad. The salad was a generous side salad with home made dressing - just the right balance to make this common salad very interesting.  The main course was delivered hot from the kitchen with the fresh fish cooked perfectly, especially for the thickness of the choice cut. The sauteed spinach was delicious too with lemon zest and a hint of garlic. My friend enjoyed the Scottish salmon and was equally impressed with his dinner.  Bricktop's offers a consistently great dinning experience.

UdymgPj0xSlFIqtjasNmnw.text: That Hana Ranch Hawaiian Ribeye. Holy crap. I think that is probably the only thing I will ever get from here if I ever come back. Sure, this place is a little pricey, but that ribeye was well worth it.  Walking in, you get a sense of high class. But, if you're not worried about the atmosphere, then I wouldn't worry about it. I went in wearing jeans, and well I can say we stood out. But who cares?  I ordered the ribeye. It melts in your mouth with a little bit of tanginess, and at the same time sweet. It was quite an experience. The loaded stuff potatoes was a little over the top. I should have ordered the Mac n cheese, but sadly I didn't do that.   Another honorable note is that their croutons are absolutely amazing. They melt in your mouth just like the rib eye. I believe they hand make them as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short rib tacos
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black bean chicken chili
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian Tuna

ICCLjYtSYyJ4TjJje4UrDg.text: Incredible food. Amazing service. Everything was perfect, the NY strip Steak, the lobster bisque, and the chocolate chip cookie/ice cream desert were all exquisitely made and prepared. Our server, Jason, was friendly and helpful. I'm very tempted to stop back here at some point to try the key lime pie as well.

KmUKLaZL57lMoxb2l-XfjQ.text: I've been to Bricktops quite a few times mostly for lunch, but recently when I tried the restraurant for dinner, it gave me a whole new appreciation for their food. Service was amazingly attentive, but not overly so, as they sat my friend and I for dinner. I chose a sushi appetizer (which I never knew they offered) AND IT WAS AWESOME. Their sushi menu is limited, but very good. For my entree I picked the Prime Rib with loaded potato and the Prime Rib was huge and a perfectly cooked medium rare (just the way I like it) and the potato was loaded to the sky and tasted amazing. A great meal and very affordable based on the portions provided.

hOIhW61Ghh3O6ZaB1VsJvQ.text: Atmosphere was a lovely service was a bit slow food was perfect but the alcohol is flowing like mud.

KyBLFIWVbNhm2PZz1qgJWw.text: Bricktop's is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Their entrees are light and flavorful, and they have great wines. They have a great patio and heat lamps in the winter, so we frequent that area. The lunch crowd is always busy, and so is dinner - so you know it's good. We never have trouble getting a spot, and if so we will just sit at the bar. The staff is usually very attentive and nice. The flavors and pairings are all good for the specials and regular food. I believe sushi is a newer add, can't vouch for it, but literally never had a bad meal here. Tried fish, chicken, steak and crab/tuna salad which is my absolute favorite. I love that I'm always satisfied but not overstuffed after leaving. It's also very classy, but not fine dining expensive, so it's a good balance. Can't recommend you go here anymore than I have, you shouldn't be disappointed!

K_pAI0ojVIh1V0sPBMmzsw.text: The deviled eggs with the millionaire's bacon was insane! Best deviled eggs and bacon EVER! We got the chicken and waffles and it was really good. The drinks were REALLY strong and tasty. We will definitely be back. Our waitress was really good as well. This is probably one of the best brunch places in Charlotte.

xwj1jnoig-vn1jb8LxrCgg.text: Exceptional dining and service! We love this place.  You get treated like royalty.  The food is first rate. We come here all the time.  We are always impressed.

CcIHqY-0kpscRDWWLd0bQQ.text: Fancy restaurant that fits right in to the very spendy Southpark neighborhood. Starting with two hostesses to greet, a large and well decorated dining area, white table linen and three staffers to take care of our table (one who did nothing but refill water glasses). If you're looking to impress, this will get 'er done.  We started with the goat cheese bruschetta which was more like a small goat cheese and veggie pizza as you'll see from the picture. Which isn't to say that it's not really really tasty and quite filling. You could easily have this as your main course.  But we didn't. Today was a "salad" day. I went with the Cobb, my wife had their "Florida". Both were good portions of protein and were very flavorful. Interesting plating for the two salads. They must put them into a cylinder of some sort where they build the layers and then "flip" it onto the plate. It looks pretty.  My only complaint is that while there was blue cheese in the salad, the dressing on the side was a balsamic and oil rather than a blue cheese dressing itself.  $14 for the pizza... I mean bruschetta and $18 or so for each of the two salads. A little expensive for a late lunch but it was quite good and I'd recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Florida salad at Bricktop&#39;s in Southpark
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb salad at Bricktop&#39;s in Southpark
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese bruschetta at Bricktop&#39;s in Southpark

dC1bxnqfyS__h7jWaQWI5g.text: You can't go wrong here! It's buzzing every night with families date nights & girls group get togethers!! Menu is 1 page (True example of do less amazingly)   Most popular not to be missed appetizer is eggs & bacon.  Perfect for 2 people to share.  Great twist on a traditional favorite.  They have my favorite salad dressing called green goddess but this didn't come out of a squeeze bottle.   I have had many items on the menu that does change from time to time.  Don't hesitate on the Pork Chop the flavor is superb & it's a great portion.  The half chicken is a little crispy outside but juicy on the inside.  If you like fish then order the grouper it'll make you an instant fan! My favorite go to is baby back ribs.  Fall off the bone with a tangy sweet sauce that is finger licking good! Don't worry hot towel is on it's way! They have shoestring fries that compliment every dish & the loaded baked potato is a generous size & heaping in "loaded".  Lol we never have room for dessert. Lol in the warmer days get there early to sit out on the patio.  Make a night out of it! ENJOY!

dM_PsTAC6GUE2_XX2DN8Tw.text: Impromptu lunch date with the fam!  Let's do it!  We actually went in blind not knowing what kind of food or anything but what a pleasant surprise! White table cloth and kinda fancy but not at all pretentious.  The service is excellent.  I wasn't super hungry so I opted for ahi salad which was perfectly delicious with mango and jicama. Yum!  The kids were impressed with their food (cheeseburger and grilled cheese) but apparently the fries were the best they'd ever had! My husband had the ahi burger which he enjoyed as well. Because l went light on lunch I indulged with dessert!  The bread pudding is DELICIOUS!!!  We will definitely be back for dinner soon.  I only took one star away because it is a bit pricey for what you get but the food is certainly good.

EZlB1vwwBh6oSPPCrIrHvQ.text: Top level service!! The devil eyes and bacon is awesome!! Always a great go to spot!  They know how to treat the customer.

SRpbG60DZMZRIYa-nTHH7A.text: We frequent Bricktop's because the food is sooo good! Never had a bad meal, and the sushi is always perfect. But the service is never on point.  Forget about sitting at the bar, the bartenders are always busy and act inconvenienced.  I'm just surprised this is a normal occurrence.

QUOJ2kEDVW4g_atVfxlYBQ.text: This was my favorite restaurant in town until last night.  Went for my birthday dinner very early 5:45.  There were lots of booths open and we were offered the worst one.  (Why do they do that? Give the first diners a great seat please!!)    Ordered a salad and it was swimming in dressing which I would have asked the waitress to replace if she'd come back around.  She didn't, so I ate it. I used to love the TROUT with capers and lemon butter.  The trout now has crab and brown butter.  It was over cooked and dry (no sauce). I wouldn't order it again. We never saw the waitress until she offered dessert.  One guy dropped off water but the service was lacking.  If it wasn't my birthday I would have asked for the manager.   Soooo disappointed! Spouses salmon and spinach were great as always.

Feyut0lLUAldTL450CkNZg.text: What happened! This is not the Bricktop's I have enjoyed in the past. There with another couple 6/26/14, looking for a long-overdue catch-up and pleasant evening.   Our initially friendly waiter turned out to be incompetent...or perhaps it was the combined team? Salads arrived before appetizers. Appetizers arrived a few minutes later, crowding the table. Entrees arrived 1 minute after the appetizers. We obviously sent entrees back, where they must have sat under a warmer until served. Ribs were okay but luke warm and broccolini was hard as a rock. To top it off, the waiter came running after us outside the restaurant accusing us of failing to sign both receipts. We encouraged him to go back and check...where he ultimately found both and gave a weak apology. This while other diners leaving the restaurant glared at us.  It will be LONG time before we return.

jxbV0j3c_qUTxauLwKIr4g.text: A A AWESOME!  i know this is a chain but I'm head over heals for the sugared bacon and deviled eggs...gluttony at it's best.  (Not one of my finer moments.)  Oh Oh..the chocolate chip cookie is baked in an iron skillet and brought to yor table that way.  Really, who does that?

QhF1aBffv9YSY01_uXPJFQ.text: The Lobster Bisque is possibly one of the best soups I have ever had in my life. It is not always on the menu, so when you see it, get it. It is crazy delicious.

DA-vmmK3orFsSeWwflzRgQ.text: Great atmosphere,awesome waitresses, and superior food!! Eating on the patio is best place

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. On patio @ brick tops

6VC9V8pUNCwUqqhPEPvzCQ.text: This place is the worst ever restaurant ever and I had a huge bug I'm my salad. The waiter didn't care at all and neither did the manager! The restrooms haven't been cleaned in months and there are cockroaches everywhere. I wouldn't take my worst enemy to this shit hole. Do yourself a favor and go Taco Bell!

QZKfto8tTCZXm1JmfTWuQw.text: I went here last weekend with a friend. I ordered the prime rib which was the best prime rib I've eaten in Charlotte. I had their hand cut fries and the yummiest fried onions on the side. The server was friendly and was knowledgeable about the menu and was able to answer specific questions for us. The was a miscommunication on my friend's order and the server pleasantly took it back immediately and corrected the order. This restaurant can be very pricey and although the good is delicious, it's more of a special occasion kind of place for us.

jO3dTyMOMl-K-dC1K-eCJw.text: Had not eaten here in years, BF knows some servers there so we went... it was excellent. We were there on Sunday around 430ish so it was very quiet.. BF has sushi (I dont eat) he said it was amazing... we also did a 1/2 of the deviled eggs and 1/2 candied bacon... both were good, bacon was a little much but it was something different to try. We also split the pizza with the beef, cant remember since its been a bit if it was short rib pizza? It was good, felt like it could have used a little less cheese and some sort of sauce... maybe a drizzle of BBQ on the top and that would have really kicked it up. I would definately go back and bring friends who had never tired... was delish!

kRdu3Ym5gPqEgeybPgh9YQ.text: Amazing place! I must start by saying that the Rosemary Grapefruit Soda there is the  BEST SODA I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!!!!!!!! I recommend it to any and everyone! The atmosphere is nice, not very french ( and I've been to france). There are big bottles of Veuve Clicquot in the front when you walk in, very inticing. The first time I visited, i went for lunch. I take a late lunch ( around 2 pm) and they were still a little busy and a little slow. But my waitor was great and I scored some free fries! They were great, "skinny', just the way I like them. I ordered the roasted chicken (half chicken) wich was about 16$ and I ate on it for days. It was seasoned well and juicy. The jus was sooooo good. I had spinach as my side which had a smokey flavor to it and parmasean (I think). My lunch guest had the salmon with spincah...Amazing, flavorful, and moist. The second time I visited was for brunch. Saldy, they were out of blood orange mimosas. So I opted for the Rosemary Grapefruit soda. Amazing choice. We started with the donuts that came with three dipping sauces. Chocolate, Raspberry, and Creme Anglaise (my fav!). They were delicious!! I ordered the French Toast with caramelized bananas, whipped cream and a side of bacon. Huge portion!! My guest orded Steak and Eggs, she said it was cooked perfectly. And of course we had frites!!! I will definitely be visiting this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Donuts!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best soda I have ever had! Grapefruit + Rosemary...they were meant for each other!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Simply amazing and juicy!

qwCCxGZzymEGbrBKKpb2MA.text: WOW!  the SoPa Cougars were right!!  This place is fantastic!  Was here Saturday for brunch.  Had the devilled eggs (comes with weird sugary bacon....not for me) but the eggs also come with spicy chili sauce - to die for!!    I had the crab salad, pretty pricey (I think it was 14-16 bucks) but was worth every penny.  Peach bellinis....need I say more.  My friend got a filet and wedge special, also awesome.  All ingredients are super fresh and presentation was gorgeous.  There is also a beautiful patio I cant wait to visit this summer.  Great decor, cozy but classy touches (the chandeliers in the bar could double as grasshopper galaxies.  Love it!

U3sGdS4rC04IdthrAXUrxQ.text: I always forget about this place and don't know why because I've always had good experiences here.  Went here last night with a group and tried almost every appetizer and they were all excellent.   They have a great bar and the "outdoor" patio area (which was closed in and heated) is a good place for a group to eat apps.  The waiters were always available and speedy getting drinks and food and were also patient with our large and loud group.

ZLoZxkn08mTfG0qKMmRGEg.text: Truthfully, I wasn't impressed.  I had the Scottish Salmon which wasn't a salmon steak as I had expected.  Instead it was served as over cooked, pressed down salmon brick.  Seriously, it was as if someone had pre-cooked salmon, flaked it and then pressed/formed it into a rectangular patty.  Tasteless and dry.  The Deviled Eggs and Millionaires Bacon was pretty good.

hnAO22vzfQZ6Opiaa6Q3qA.text: Overall good food, albeit can be on the salty side if you are not careful (soup and tortilla chips), but they deserve recognition for their service and customer interaction.  After receiving the wrong order for takeout, we were invited back to correct the mistake, our credit card was credited, and they emailed us a $25 gift card to welcome us back.  This is a restaurant that is working hard to make their customers happy and with good food, we'll be back!

Q6jVl7Y2Wt55pyKN8ZMZXQ.text: This place used to be good, but has really gone downhill. The last time we went there, we had to send back three things because they were wrong or just plain bad. Too bad because this used to be the closest thing to Houston's in Charlotte.

9zJIud_lh45SnE58XnjoSA.text: Bricktops was wonderful I had the crusted parm chicken w/ spinach an the flatbread app with a bowl of lobster bisque.  The lobster bisque was as wonderful as when i was paula deans lady n sons :)  There was not just tiny pieces of lobster there were big pieces.  The flatbread very light, not heavy so to spoil you for your entree.  the crusted chicken w/ tomatotes and capers wonderful.  My freind had the ribs, they fell right off the bone, i tried one they melted in your mouth.  For desert the hot fudge sundae very light just enough to get that sweet for the ending of your meal.  I will be back to bricktops , service was great an staff was so friendly :)

RDKzgpzcjGASuuquZDOWOg.text: Pretty good/consistent fare but a touch expensive for one notch above average food.  $16-$20 salads are a bit much. Steak Frites were good but not great.

mMbMUbEz-orHWoQE3RI2-w.text: This place has gotten a lot of bad reviews which surprises me a little.  I used to work within walking distance and it was my go to place for lunch when taking out clients... they were always impressed with the menu choices and decor.  I don't care what a restaurant looks like, but you know how clients are...  would rather have a pretty meal than a good one.    Just kidding, clients, love you forever!  Please keep sending me big checks!  By the way, have I told you that you look great today?  wink, wink...  On different occasions I have tried their crab salad, chicken sandwich, fish special, artichoke dip, calamari, and burger.  I found the food to be pretty good, simple and seasoned well.  I'm not a huge  fan of what the kids call "New American" food, but I thought this place was good.  Apologies if I am using the term incorrectly...   I have noticed that people give it good reviews for lunch and bad for dinner... may want to skip it at night.

7iveWGzdbporxVjzZ-nBPg.text: It is pretty good, but a bit over rated and also slightly overpriced. The deviled eggs are talked up a lot. They are good, but they are deviled eegs. The only thing that makes them special is the Sugar Bacon.  I had lunch there and the tuna sandwich was good, but it was served with a run of the mill hamburger bun. Really ... You couldn't have done better than a lame bun?

YBT0b0Jr7EXXtrx7LkqCzA.text: Brick Tops is my go-to place!! Right around the corner from where I live, my family loves to drive (or even walk) over for a relatively inexpensive, delicious meal. Last night, my sister and I  treated ourselves to the  grilled artichoke to start and then, per usual, I ordered the fish tacos. The blackened fish of the day was Mahi Mahi and paired with fresh guacamole, white cheddar and brown  rice, they were amazing. There is pretty much nothing on the menu that I wouldn't recommend. The people are super friendly and the service is speedy.

mOMQ0jkweT0Y7C_SKrq9ag.text: I loved the food here as did everyone else I was with.  We ordered a few appetizers-the deviled eggs, pizzas, etc.  Everything was delicious!! The bacon that came on the side with the deviled eggs was to die for! I ordered the ahi tuna salad and I ate every single bite.  It was perfect--light and refreshing.  The tuna was seared to perfection!! Everyone was happy with their food as well--ranging from steaks to lamb to other salads.  The wines we ordered were delicious as well!  The service was excellent :)

ppomZBY1nXzmylz5NhEd7w.text: Great brunch! Started with the donut appetizer - the vanilla, chocolate and raspberry dipping sauces are great - but the donuts are also delicious without any sauce. I ordered the crab benedict and my husband ordered the chicken and waffle. As soon as noon rolled around the bartender brought out my Bloody Mary. I was disappointed that the only garnish was a lemon wedge, I'm a big fan of traditional (and creative) Bloody Mary toppings. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the mix (not sure if it's homemade.) My husband enjoyed his chicken and waffle, but had to remove a huge melting pond of butter from the middle of the waffle. My crab benedict was fantastic as well, well poached eggs atop an English muffin (homemade?) with a generous pile of lump crabmeat. I especially liked the hollandaise sauce which was particularly lemony, which complemented the crabmeat well. The roasted potatoes that came with the meal were perfectly cooked, soft insides and crispy outside with great seasoning. The food was a little on the pricey side, so we won't be regulars, but it was a terrific meal. Our server was a bit too nonchalant and actually left the wrong table's check with us at first, but everything came out as we ordered it and the food was delicious, so we'll overlook it.

bP8fCy75vNa4fs2vT88K8Q.text: Tried this place out for brunch this past weekend with the parentals. Very warmly greeted when first entered and given a table immediately (we had reservations but you never know how those will go HAHA). Anyway, our server was very nice. They were pretty busy as it was a Sunday morning and we had a bit of a delay with the food. We tried the guac and salsa appetizer and it was really good. I had a blueberry waffle with fruit but the waffle comes warm and had a lot of butter on it which I tried to remove (I didn't want it too soggy) but it still got the middle of the waffle pretty soggy. It also didn't come with syrup so I had to ask for that separate but that was no big deal. My sister got one of the salads but mentioned that it was soggier than usual (with dressing) and she thought it was only so-so. We tried the doughnuts for dessert and they were covered in sugar so super sweet. Good idea though, who doesn't love dipping food in chocolate?!

ErIXu1a_HZXXG7DvrIjAXw.text: Not impressed at all! First there was a 20 minute wait to sit on the heated patio so we opted to sit at the bar. We started with spinach artichoke dip which was bland and boring for 10.00. The bartender was ok she dint ask if it was good or not and after two bites I decided not to waste my calories. Next I ordered the lobster roll figuring what was the special had to be good. My husband had a crab salad with shrimp and avocado. When my lobster roll arrived it was on a hamburger bun???? With sesame seeds? The lobster was ok blah completely not quality of 19.00 no one asked if it was ok.  I ate half and she took my plate. My husband salad had so much avocado and hardly any lettuce. I definitely will not waste 60.00 for lunch here again. What a bad choice!

vEPbu4q2ulOIQIQX6C6SSw.text: This is a 4.75 star review.  I have had lunch and dinner at Bricktop's many times and have never been disappointed.  Please be aware however, I do not stray far from a few favorites on the menu.  Their veggie burger is the best I have had in Charlotte.  Their chicken tenders are also the best (no, I am not a 7 year-old child.)  Their salads, soup specials, and vegetable features are also top notch.  The deviled eggs and sugar bacon appetizer are VERY popular and delicious.  Where I dropped the review 0.25 stars is for price.  The restaurant is not the least expensive for lunch; BUT, in Southpark, nothing is inexpensive.  Parking availability is limited in front of the restaurant and additional parking is available throughout the retail area.  Where I am most impressed with Bricktop's is their service.  Granted, I am a regular, but I have always appreciated the teamwork of the professional servers.  It takes a village and Bricktop's has well-trained the Team to help each other.

TWXQs2o07Vkv1A6vzM-HnQ.text: So my parents were in town this weekend and I now realize where my indecisive nature comes from as we debated FOREVER about where to go on fathers day. It had to be close to my grandmothers ....dad wanted a big portion (as I prefer small plates so we did a lot of that for the majority of the weekend) ...and mom is super picky in the food department.  We finally decided on South Park and after circling for quite some time we let my dad make the executive decision. My dad walked into our first stop (Bricktops) and noticed the cranking AC and Prime rib and decided this would be our eating destination.   I had a salad and the pr special and felt both were pretty delicious considering how hungry I was. The twice baked potato had enough salt, butter, and cheese to qualify it as heart-attack inducing but tasty none-the-less! We spoiled ourselves and had dessert, I really enjoyed the chocolate chip cookie sundae thing and the key lime pie garnered rave reviews from the rest of the table.   Service was really great, I must say. Our server was on top of everything and made great recommendations. Considering how busy it was I was impressed.   Clean, beautiful, bright food ...it is not. Stuff your face on fathers day ...it is. I'm not sure id go back on my own but I wouldn't be against having another one of those twiced baked potatoes (following a long gym session!)

VAzxt6zR4ivBHIGWLaK-Gg.text: Food is always excellent. Price is a little high but you are paying for excellent service, great food and not being bothered. While we were there we sat next to a famous racecar driver, wife and little girl. No one stared or bothered them. Normal to see this in neighborhood. Deviled eggs are impeccable and I always order them. Sauteed spinach, salads, burger, fish tacos... Can't go wrong. All great. Love the artwork.  Dressy casual attire

7JFeZ18baiajNVZ6YNAlzQ.text: Best mac n cheese in Charlotte and best ahi tuna burger  ever.  The service was good and awesome bloody mary bar for Sunday brunch.

OBF-I2k9ZOv-6x5rsdaDUQ.text: Bricktop's is tucked away behind SouthPark Mall a block away from where you think it is. -- To wit: not behind Walgreen's. Any time I go west on Morrison from Sharon, I'm heading to the Mall and turn left before I get to 6401. Heaven forbid you should go to Bojangle's instead! (shudder!)   I entered in the mood for a cheeseburger and I successfully resisted the temptation of a very good-looking menu.  But oh! What a burger! I was told by our waiter that since they ground their own beef, I could get it close to the rare the nanny state won't allow us to have.  It came to the table in like two minutes, dripping with hot, juicy deliciousness. So juicy, in fact, that it soaked the bun into a soggy, doughy mess. Halfway through, I discarded the remains of a once-crispy toasted bun and finished off the piece of cow with my fork.  Friends, that cow died a noble death in a worthy cause.  Even the humble French Fries were remarkably tasty. I'm a light eater and usually get two meals from any restaurant. Not this time. I almost whacked our waiter's knuckles when he politely reached to remove my plate. I was sitting, talking, sipping, and enjoying the feeling of being comfortably full, but still nibbling at my fries.  Rita had the deviled eggs and sugar bacon. The eggs were good, but the bacon was de-freakin-licious!  The drinks were strong and plentiful. My wife's favorite pet peeve is a Martini that only fills half the glass. A cheap bar will short you two thirds of a drink that way. Any place that serves you a third of a Martini is probably cheating you other ways, too. This one was full to the brim and frosted.  My rum and Coke was strong enough to rise up and walk across the table by itself. The well liquors are good, too. No need to call.  Our servers, trainer and trainee, were never more than a glance away. As he walked through the dining area, his eyes would track right and left. We were always able to catch his eye.   I hate giving five stars! I really do. But they didn't do anything wrong!  I'll be back to give them a chance to lower their score. That's fair . . . right?

ZFcItvae_vnU_Wt9244yYg.text: I have been to Bricktops many times and have ordered many different dishes.  My favorite is their Veggie Burger!  Not expected at a place like this, but their Veggie Burger Rocks!  The chicken fingers are light and crispy. Their fries are thin strips of crunchy goodness! The ribs are tender and juicy. I could go on....  The only negative is their pour.  Perhaps because it was Wednesday Martini Special Night, but their pour was very weak.  Also, I asked for Cointreau and received triple sec - huge flavor difference to those who know.  Never the less, I still give Bricktop's a 4 star as their food is always good!

9ChNbgCummvV2lETioLT5Q.text: I still keep my rating at 3 stars after my last two visits. The food and service were very good. I had the Filet this week and it was excellent. They are getting a price premium because of the neighborhood the restaurant is located in. The price value is good, not great.

Rwnh1VT2dzLhOSmEIjy6pA.text: Food is good and service is good. But nothing is great, except the millionaire bacon. And in my opinion the food is over priced. I have the 4 star ranking because the food is good.

VGW667ROZgD8VAgA5jNWCw.text: Visit Bricktop's at Specialty Shops on the Park for the best happy hour in town!

AR6KesvnXf2FeDSzyuPkIQ.text: Seriously, the deviled eggs with bacon crumbles on top may be the best I've ever had. The restaurant is in South Park, which is a really nice area of Charlotte.

Rf9hgX88Siv7ugXIMvaqWg.text: For the longest time, I was under the impression that Bricktops was a pizza joint, albeit one of those "upscale" ones where they smother your wood-fired pizza with food stuffs that simply don't belong on a pizza. Salmon? Are you kidding me?   But I was mistaken, and gladly so. I was pleasantly surprised with Bricktops upon my first visit, and I've been there 3 times since. And each time I've eaten at Bricktops, my dining experience has been better than the previous time.   My first time, I popped my cherry there with a cheeseburger. I figure if you can't screw up a cheeseburger, then you're likely to know what you're doing in the kitchen. Bricktops passed this test with flying colors. One of the best cheeseburgers in town, no joke, and complimented pleasantly with a very generous serving of shoestring fries. First visit, color me impressed.  Second time around, my family and I dined there on New Year's Eve. A bit of trepidation surrounded my dining experience at first; I've been to several NYE dine-ins that have been nothing short of awful because of the importance of the holiday and a stunning lack of planning on a restaurant's management's part. But not at Bricktops. Reservations were honored without fail, our meal prepared with the utmost attention to detail and taste, and our waiter was very friendly and attentive, despite the buzz and the clamor in the air. I opted for the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, which was wonderful. Nothing beats chicken so tender you can fork it. My wife chose a New York Strip, Pittsburgh style, which she thought was very delicious. I sampled a couple of bites. Unbelievably tasty. My daughter loved her salmon and noodles, and for eating her plate clean, she was rewarded with a bowl of vanilla ice cream. Not just frozen, store-bought ice cream, but fresh-churned ice cream, the vanilla tasting of real vanilla bean. I can't say who enjoyed this more, my daughter or me.  Last visit there, I chose the veggie burger. Pardon my french, but HOLY SHIT, that is one spectacular veggie burger! Listen, just run there right now and try it. I guarantee you will not be disappointed.  A word about the Deviled Eggs & Sugared Bacon: what you've heard about this sinful delicacy is True. You can't just eat them. You find yourself DEVOURING them. Order a plate for you and your sweetie, and a fight for the last strip of bacon and the last sliced egg may break out, and it's gonna get ugly. So order two plates, one for you and one for him/her. Your relationship will be the better for it.  After 3 visits - and possibly a fourth coming this weekend - I can easily make the claim that Bricktops has become my favorite, go-to eatery in the Queen City, replacing my one-beloved 131 Main.

MvGaKMQpQGrlgyENFGbOLg.text: I was referred to Bricktops by a friend of mine who swore by their build-your-own Bloody Mary bar.  The brunch date me and Bryan went on here was somewhat of a disappointment in that area, as they stopped doing it the week before.  Also, remember if you go on a Sunday you cannot order am adult beverage until 12:00 pm..... We were at our table for an hour and a half!  Our poor server! I will say, I had the chicken and waffles and they were outrageously good! My first experience with that Southern goodness dish...... I was impressed with Bricktops but haven't made it back after my first visit.  I will say if you go, go early! It gets packed by the family-churchgoers :)

3eIJJupX3nDdOds9HnaUXA.text: Yummy...a little shopping and then some dinner.  This is my neighbors favorite restaurant and after hearing her rant and rave about it - the boyfriend and I finally decided to stop on in.  it's conveniently located across from Southpark mall and has a lot of seating indoor and outdoor. The menu is American with a nice selection of seafood and beef.  Carpaccio is by far my favorite appetizer that exists and Bricktops did not disappoint the Filet Mignon was top notch.  I opted for a salad for my meal and was very pleased with my selection - lump crab meat, shrimp, avocados this girl could not have been happier.  Oh and I can't remember what night I went but they had $6 martini's - of course at that price how could I resist a dirty martini  with blue cheese stuffed olives oh yeah baby. Next stop I will try their brunch :)

EWBO3-hgK46-UuXiPocPqA.text: I ate here for Sunday bunch. We got the Deviled egg appetizer. It was delicious! For my entree I got a French dip. I was very disappointed by it!  It was extremely fatty and very chewy. I've been there several times and this was the first time I was Disappointed. No French Dip for me next time.

d5rVPCmKx4EU2YzmolnzZQ.text: I found two pubic hairs in two separate dishes, a lobster bisque and the trout.  The staff was rude to me and my guest for an evening that was in a word: gross in both its uncleanliness and its response - they asked if i wanted another entree ...i said no, ....if i  am the manager I am both embarrassed and and apologetic.  The quality of the food and the management team has slipped from my other visits as well.  It feels more like a chain that special place.

f5JpxRu5kVdx83hWOxkl6Q.text: I went in and ordered the cookie dessert.  It is brought out on a hot skillet.  The chocolate chip cookie is on the bottom with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and caramel drizzled all over.  When biting into the cookie it tasted like a homemade cookie.  It was soft and melted in your mouth.  The cookie wasn't over cooked at all.  The ice cream adds a cold mix to the hot cookie.  The caramel is a perfect topping because it doesn't make the dessert to chocolaty.  The desert cost about $6 and it is worth every penny.  The service is great and I would recommened going to Bricktops, there flat bread pizza, hand made veggie burgers and fries are all really good.

x9tRMAxeB3Lw4o8I-VfukQ.text: Had lunch here, fabulous food. Have to try the deviled eggs, they are a little sweet but so addictive. Everything was wonderful! Great service too!

gTy83HvgDhLwfdrSh2B7VA.text: We made a reservation at Brick Tops for Queen's Feast.  The table was ready for us when we arrived early, our dining partners were held up in traffic and were 15 minutes late.  Restaurant Week is a busy time for many of the nice places in Charlotte, but we were treated to the superior service and fabulous food we have enjoyed in the past, even though it was Restaurant Week and they were very busy.  We were not rushed at all, the food was perfectly cooked and we had a relaxing and enjoyable meal.  PLUS, we could hear each other speak at the table.  We could actually have a conversation!  This is so rare today with all the restaurants doing nothing to quiet the sound.  I would pick Brick Tops any time we want a nice meal out with friends.  Absolutely loved it and so did our friends who had never been there.  I will sing their praises to anyone who will listen!

6Lq9lVGM8TZLCzMSpFyRFw.text: Amazing experience! Had Sunday brunch here-shrimp & grits divine, california benedict delicious & mac & cheese for my toddler was perfect! The server was very polite & helpful with everything. Great place to bring kids.

5dL0WameHSI2aQ57LL5tvQ.text: I had multiple people recommend Bricktop's, so I saved it for a special occasion. We recently visited for a weeknight dinner and were not left wanting. The staff was friendly and attentive, even giving us a card for our anniversary. We tried sushi, the artichoke dip, seared ahi and chicken with pasta. Each dish was top notch! After our visit, I heard about an off menu dish, saving that for next time. I'm reserving that 5th star for at least one return trip, prospects are good!

EaEcTw4-4eZqWWDbF9X6DA.text: Had a great experience tonight (definitely more fancy than we thought but nonetheless very accepting and wonderful). Our server, Dani, was extremely pleasant and answered all of our questions. She also had great recommendations and made our experience here so wonderful. If you get a chance to go here, ask for your server to be Dani!

QtQ3-fs9I4dQQ9_5WuN6-g.text: The last few times we have gone we have waited soooo long to get our food.  We went as a family with our kids and waited almost an hour for our food.  We have been many times and I m not sure what us going on.  The food and service are good though.

QGhtkO77CqqQ3pXHTA5Nuw.text: This is a very nice restaurant. The atmosphere is very relaxing to me. I ordered the Scottish salmon and butter beans. The fish was very fresh and filling. They offered great portion sizes. My waitress was very accommodating and patient. I enjoyed and will be back again. I am not sure of the wait times here normally, because I had a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer Deviled Eggs without bacon
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

L1MTKUUl8gRZlEotwu8Y-w.text: Has always been a good standby, but food/service used to be so much better.  Used to always get a great pour here, but this time our drinks were watery and weak, both the martini and gin/tonic. Server was friendly at first(Roy), but he than he spent more time watching b-ball reruns on tv, while our wine bottle grew hot in his hands, our food grew cold before he served us, or he dared to clear our table. Crab cakes, that we normally love were made with not so fresh crab. Snapper was over cooked and broccoli was cut in HUGE, old and yellowing florets. It was inedible. Only good thing tonight was the grilled artichoke with aioli.  We probably won't be back any time soon, after enjoying this place for years. As we left, we walked past the beverage station that stunk of old, stinky wash rags. Yuck! Time for this place to clean up its act, but based on the automatic biz from the old folks crowd and hotel neighbors, doubt they'll even try. What a shame. So disappointed!

fiViKHF-CpiWLJ0ITcTSkw.text: Went to Bricktop's for our Anniversary. We were looking for a nice meal and a long conversation. When we arrived, we were concerned with the noise because of a significant number of families, but when we were seated, we had a nice table in the back of the restaurant.   The only negative of the restaurant was parking.   Everything else was incredibly positive.   Nice pace from the server. Never rushed. Never wondering where he was.   Had the Beet/Goat Cheese Salad - split it (no additional charge). It was very nice and light.   My wife had the filet and creamed spinach.   I had the NY Strip and Fettuccine Alfredo.   Then, we split a baked potato...  Wow...we were so excited about the food. My wife said it was the best steak she had eaten in some time.   We ended our meal with the bread pudding. I've had bread pudding all over the world. This was among the best. The sauce and the creme anglaise were perfect. What an ending to a great evening.   It's noisy, but just enough so that you don't think people can hear your conversation.   It's casual enough to feel comfortable, but nice enough for our anniversary.   We will return.

fUTI6ZA9N6TBvQMk63HV9w.text: I had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant for a work dinner function and was very pleasantly surprised of the quality of food and service here. I had the Florida grouper and it was cooked perfectly - just right so it was not dry. The key lime pie was a little different than the traditional style but still quite tasty. Hope to return next time I am here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Key lime pie
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grouper

MzHomufFlQf4M_0bbE1Ipg.text: Excellent meal. I had the pork chop with mashed potatoes. The pork chop was thick but still tender and cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes seemed fresh made. For the price, it should come with a small salad. It's mostly business casual dress. I was there in a t-shirt but the staff was still polite and attentive. I felt comfortable.

H1UzCBwiySC6xV5Em-FHWw.text: I was so excited to learn that Bricktop's added the lobster roll to the everyday menu instead of just the Friday lunch menu. I love the fish tacos, roasted chicken, and crab cakes here, but they have one of the best lobster rolls in town (pure lobster meat on a warm buttered bun rather than a little bit of lobster meat with a lot of filler). Waiters are always very friendly. Whenever there's a long wait, you can generally get a seat in the bar area rather quickly - the service is also great in the bar.

Jh9YvfOFu0yqa5L7UvC7OA.text: Bricktops was an all around disappointment!   Cold mac and cheese and broccoli. They did bring some back piping hot, but this time they were both overcooked. The broccoli could have fallen of the stem.   The initial bite of the mashed potatoes seemed pretty good, but had a strange unbecoming lasting flavor.    My friend ordered the Trout with fries. She said it was ok and the fries were the best part of her meal.   The Cream of corn - for me, was practically the only saving grace to this place.   The manager Jamie Stegall, was very apologetic. Also a saving grace to the whole experience! She was sweet and offered to bring anything else with no cost. She sweetly packed up some cream of corn to go with her card to receive a free dessert the next time I come.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside, seams enticing! But we had a bad experience!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Broccoli and mac-n-cheese came out cold. Mashed potatoes had a strange lasting taste. Cream of corn was fresh and delicious!!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The trout - My friend said it&#39;s only so, so (tastes fresh from the freezer) - The fries were the best part!

6MPXQSvSMy6v_Sryiqh1HA.text: The waiter was not at his best with his customer service. He was rude and very impatience with our group. It was a party of 8 and he was just not in the customer service mood. We when for brunch I order the chicken and waffles the waffles were cold had to send back twice. Not sure what was going on today. I eat here often

prDo03AuybPm1lFQM-CY5g.text: Came here to avoid "hotel food". Sadly, got hotel food. Fries were excellent, but medium burger was well done and broccoli was mediocre. They never asked me about food quality....just if I wanted a drink or dessert.

DS_yKbCqYw3KXFc9Pg8VRg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte --- seriously. Do yourself a favor and head there right now. We always make it here during the Queen's Feast/Restaurant Week. This time, we took a newbie friend with us, and she said "how have I never been here before ... this place is amazing!"  For appetizers: you absolutely have to get the deviled eggs & millionaire's bacon. The eggs are probably some of the best in the South, and the bacon is basically candied/glazed ... all the NOMS.  Entrees: My go-to is without a doubt the baby back ribs. They're so tender they just drop right off the bone. You get a huge rack, probably about 12 bones or so. More than enough. The ribs come with fries & cole slaw. I'm not a huge slaw fan, so I always sub it out. GET THE MAC N' CHEESE. Seriously, it's insanely good. The crab cakes are also amazing --- great size and huge chunks of fresh crab. My wife and I didn't really care for the quinoa-kale salad too much that it came with ... but to each their own. You can't go wrong ordering either of this. My wife and I usually get these and split our dinners to get the best of both worlds. If you're more of a chicken person, the Parmesan crusted chicken is incredible and the service size is insane ... easily two meals worth.   Alright, stop reading and make your reservations now!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baby back ribs served with shoe-string French fries and macaroni &amp; cheese
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jumbo-lump Crab Cakes with a whole-grain mustard sauce served with kale &amp; quinoa salad. $28

BxaIsYI93mr6Yz_iGBhB0w.text: Bricktop's topped our list of places to eat on this trip to Charlotte. We came on a suggestion from Yelp, but our  expectations were surpassed by the food and more importantly, the service. Rasheda is everything you want in a server. Period. She took such good care of us, and made us feel valued. Her recommendations were so on point and any requests that we made were fulfilled almost immediately. The prime meatloaf, the steak, and the Chilean sea bass were excellent, and the show stopper may have been the creamed spinach.'The serve staff worked as a team to meet the needs of us dining there. The manager was pleasant and friendly, engaging in conversation with us and actually allowed us to brag on our server without once trying to take any credit. Couldn't recommend Bricktop's enough!

HQ8Vf7_njviyTg828xVUUQ.text: I love the atmosphere here. The first time I went it was a cold, rainy afternoon so there weren't many patrons. This time the after work crowd was out in full force. There was no wait thankfully. The server was warm and attentive, she easily answered any questions about what was on the menu.  I had a sushi roll (I think it was Dynamite) which was very good. Topped it off with their delicious baked macaroni and cheese. I always enjoy Bricktops.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi &amp; Mac
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi!

tPT7Ojnqd_BS0_Bk5te-QQ.text: Without question THE best ribs in Charlotte! Absolutely amazing! The French Dip is also incredible as well.

yy42dOaJNLf0INVuDeQ9lw.text: I have been to Bricktops three times and each time gets better than the last.  This restaurant is very popular with a great vibe, great food, and friendly service.    To save you time, start with the deviled eggs appetizer.  I ordered the eggs because I have never seen a restaurant brave enough to add a dish that is best remembered from a church potluck - what's next ... tater Tots casserole?  However, I was rewarded not only with tasty eggs, but with a candied bacon (they call millionaire's bacon) that literally had me fighting my clients for the last piece.  We also ordered the Shangri-la roll which is a combination a spicy roll, a California roll, and a rainbow roll.  I don't care what you combine as long as it is delicious.  The last two times I have ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with a miso soy marinade.  You can't go wrong here and it is buttery as the best sea bass I have had, but my table mates steaks also looked amazing.  We finished off with a chocolate chip cookie which is served warm in a cast iron pan with some ice cream on top.  Definitely check out Bricktops if you can get a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled Eggs at Bricktops in Charlotte

gYLx5RQO_TZUSMXPRoNJ_Q.text: Went there for dinner last night with my coworker. Crowded but got seated right away. Cool vibe, great server, outstanding food, scrumptious dessert!!   I ordered the Bistro Chicken -- pan sauteed, thinly sliced, served with creamy whipped potatoes & fresh sauteed spinach -- heaven on a plate. I ate every last crumb on my plate.   The dessert didn't disappoint - do desserts ever disappoint though? Vanilla ice cream with espresso and truffle almonds - I wanted another one.   My coworker order the filet with mashed potatoes and got a side of roasted corn.  Do yourself a favor and order that side. You won't be disappointed.  She ordered the chocolate chip cookie and she loved it!!  We definitely made the right decision and we definitely will go back when we are in  Charlotte!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nom nom nom - she loved the chocolate chip cookie!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. My vanilla ice cream with espresso! Took vanilla ice cream to a new level for me!!

-86w7hZhfXVJO7vGe9cx2Q.text: Loved Bricktop's! Best ribs I've ever had (and I've had them in los of places). Gluten free wasn't an issue. Thanks for having a great wine selection and not gouging your Customers! Great decor and service!

xopzm-OozVr_ec5lvvuGLQ.text: Great place for consistent lunch and dinner meals.  Comfortable setting with efficient and attentive wait staff

AgbHQHET3IvRS21R7D2--w.text: This place is just so good.  The service is the best in Charlotte--better than any of the fancy restaurants.

ENGO92sAoBbmXgGygUdvuw.text: I was so looking forward to having lunch here!  The hostess and the wait staff were wonderful and very attentive.  A tiny salad and two small strips of tuna steak was $18.00 and not very good.  There are fabulous places in the exact same area that are much better for less money.

R4xCFcXw46J8Jr910saFww.text: Not sure if it was a bad night but everything was terrible including the service. The "millionaire's" bacon was burned. The grilled artichoke over cooked. The $16 "sushi" roll looks like it came from Harris Teeter. Most disturbing was how terrible the service was. This was once a go-to place but now it is off the list. Don't waste your time or money here

RHoIylQpfh9KiEo1_rr-5Q.text: This was our third visit to Bricktops and I think we expected more. In the past we sat in the bar area but this time we tried the dining room area. The service was great both in the bar and dining area. Our server Adam was very attentive, friendly and gave recommendations which we appreciated. I ordered the recommended crab cakes and the bf ordered the tuna. The cakes were amazing as I was told they would be and the tuna just ok. The downfall for us is that we expected more food for the price we were paying.. next time we plan on sticking with their chicken tenders as they are always awesome.

5CWJws1dXLfk_pz3FNiXdg.text: Wedge salad very good. I had the French dip. I asked for medium rare prime rib. This was not honored. It was still pretty good.   My friend had fish tacos. She didn't comment.   Beautiful surroundings.   Service cut a star off my rating. Our server was clueless to nuances.

b8uy21ON9JToYBCuHVdPOg.text: Brunch was good but the proportions were small for the amount of money. I left feeling like I spent a fortune and didn't feel it was worth what I spent.   Overall, the food is good and the donuts are to die for.   I think this is a place to experience once, but I don't know if I would go back for the price.

4UXbA4IeJU5Mq5jkm_zyGA.text: The sushi was delicious but the service was why I wanted to write a review. I couldn't help but notice how nice the servers were to each other. I saw them helping each other like a team and it was very noticeable. Melissa was great at the bar! She was friendly & efficient and treated my son and I with great consideration. We were only in Charlotte one night for a soccer tournament and we wanted to go somewhere fun. It was a little pricey but I knew that before we went. Thanks Bricktop's for a great experience!

090GTu807p0NBYeqIlHGlQ.text: 2/7/17 Another 5 stars for this great restaurant      My server was very very good and very attentive  Food and service excellent ! Disappointed that they no longer have daily specials they were a nice add to the regular menu Today daily specials were sushi not a fan of sushi  Happy that they always now have the steak and fries  Will gladly go back  as often as I am in South Park

9D539btrYnBsLYySEUpuTw.text: Excellent brunch for our party! The pluses of this restaurant is how they can have great service and good food, and a fair price point. We had a big group with a variety of people--foodies to meat/potato people. Bricktops pleased everyone with their menu options for brunch--breakfast or lunch choices. My favorite is the fish tacos and you can change the side to one of their veggies or do the fries. I have also tried the warm chocolate chip cookies for dessert & they're scrumptious! Reservations recommended.

k8RVW270mmXGb-JOHU34Vw.text: Two words for this place: Deviled Eggs.  This place is a zoo for lunch (haven't gone for dinner) with the south park business crowd. Nothing I've ever gotten here has been bad... the service is decent. I think the only beef I have with the restaurant is that they have dinner prices at lunch.

utBmlZBTlV3ywHbnBxgC-A.text: Sunday brunch met my expectations. The doughnut appetizer is served with a trio of sauces: raspberry, chocolate and creme anglaise. The doughnuts were really nice. My mom makes just as good or better, but these are still worth it.   The Bel Air Benedict comes with a thick sliced tomato, a good amount of fresh avocado and a poached egg on an English muffin and topped with hollandaise. The hollandaise was a bit thick and not lemony enough for my taste, and the egg was cooked a little too much (most of the yellow was hard), but overall the combination of flavors worked.  The home fries served with the Benedict were salty and seasoned and crispy.   The French Toast with caramelized bananas and maple syrup was the perfect sweet counterbalance to the Eggs Benedict. I appreciated that the syrup was real maple and the butter was real butter. (Sad how often that is not the case.) If possible, I recommend sharing 2 dishes to get the best of savory and sweet.

npGlTeKcYoIKKsuM6VcQNg.text: Bricktop's may not seem like anything unique when looking at the menu or location but don't be fooled. This restaurant, while it is large, has the wonderful service level of a small restaurant. The entrees they offer are 100% of the time well prepared and the kitchen is always willing to meet special accommodations. Some of my favorites include the crab cake and prime rib

2c0jw6smKnVFdrjxZk7lug.text: Went here for the first time a couple of days ago.  Quickly seated and service was attentive even though they were very busy. Food was of good quality.  Pleasant decor. My wife said it is an older persons place but there was  a variety of clientele. I would like to go back here again.  Good flavor to the food.

xzJ_8RQi6HllAWMYHBd8-w.text: Rolled in with a party if 17 and Collin, jessica and Jason took such great care of us!! Excellent food, timely delivery! Drinks never went empty!! Highly recommend for a fun night with family or friends!!!

F4c6NTMw99Y28AiShWMxMw.text: We were in town on business, staying nearby. Checked out this place at the beginning of the week and loved it! We had a great waitress and the food came out very fast. Food was delicious. Chicken dishes and steak were done perfectly. We returned later in the week. Service not as great the second day. Food was delicious though! Great lobster bisque and sushi.

yCMsSEqCAC-vIICJDcZwVQ.text: Hard to find good prime rib in Charlotte, but their prime rib is great. Fantastic food and desserts, Bricktops never disappoints.

lzQA3CgdyVmQUgWGHPQa0A.text: went for brunch. donuts delicious, small bites made to order and with three different dippings (chocolate, strawberry, cream), popcorn shrimps nice and crispy but there were not "whole" shrimps inside, just small pieces. crab cakes Delicious, fresh, tasty, moist enough and well cooked outside. Fries were also Super good, the cut is the fine one, which is my favorite.  The place is casual, large comfortable tables with sofa, diner style but more elegant.

wkzjmWCTHWYGdsNt1C5ntA.text: I am absolutely in LOVE with BrickTop's. I stumbled here on accident one day looking for  mozzarella sticks, which I found out they don't serve. But, they DO make THE BEST Prickly Pear Margarita I have ever had anywhere in the wold. It is DELICIOUS. The spinach and artichoke dip is fabulous. I always get steak tacos with insanely good fries. And of course you can not leave without eating a cookie-in-a-pan. The menu is limited, but everything on it is sooooo GOOD.   The place also has a nice, comfortable atmosphere and it is always clean. I DO think it is expensive, and my husband and I both do not like to spend money wastefully, but honestly, the food is soooo good it's worth the price.   I can't recommend this place enough. It is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I think I will head there now for a Prickly Pear Marg.... soooooo good....

EhqaKXZBByZzel8ruJQ1nw.text: I polled a few people and everyone agreed: Bricktop's sounds like a pizza place.  Having never been to Bricktop's, we decided to give it a try this past Saturday evening.  It was nicely decorated inside with a modern, upscale vibe, but comfortable enough that you could still dress casual (but not too casual).  We didn't have a reservation, but we were seated within 10-15 minutes.    The menu is basically "American" food; there didn't appear to be any other theme to it.  We started out with the deviled eggs and sugar bacon appetizer, only because it sounded unique and certainly not something you see every day on a menu.  The eggs were good, but nothing special about them.  The sugar bacon was basically dessert for us.  Wow.   Tasty, but oh-so-sweet.    None of the entrees -- basic steaks, chicken, fish -- really jumped out at me, so I went with the Ahi Tuna Burger.  It was quite a fabulous sandwich, topped with a ginger dressing slaw (lettuce, carrots; no cabbage thankfully).  It was full of flavor, and I enjoyed every bite.  I chose fries as my side item, and they were thin slices of fried potato with a delicious coating.  I enjoyed them, too!  It was a good dinner experience and I'd recommend it for people who like a great meal but don't like anything too crazy food-wise.  I'd call it a nice "meat and potatoes"-type restaurant.

NlEP5u3VfDBAMqxJvle3Yg.text: I almost hate giving out a big ol' 5 star review based on one visit, but I don't mind giving a low rating on one visit, so turnabout is fair play!  The fella and I took our first trip to BrickTop's on a Wednesday night; the main reason we went was because they were one of the few places NOT doing Restaurant Week.  We made an 8:00 pm reservation and were greeted and seated right away when we got there at 7:50.  The place was a little more fancy than we'd expected; it felt like a 131 Main or Vine to me with the dark wood, gauzy lighting fixtures overhead, and numerous booths.  We had a view of the bar from where we sat, and it looked pretty inviting and a little swanky.  Our waitress was prompt, engaging and friendly.  We started with the deviled egg & sugar bacon appetizer ($10), which was good, but not as great as I expected.  The sugar bacon was super chewy, but the eggs were good - almost sweet as opposed to vinegary like most deviled eggs.  I can't knock off points on the bacon though because... well, it's bacon.    For dinner, I got the Parmesan crusted chicken ($22) with lemon butter sauce and capers and a baked potato for my side, and the fella got the prime meatloaf (which was more like a large cone of delicious meat) and a side of the Cinderella whipped potatoes ($22).  The chicken was the best thing I've eaten in a loooong time with a buttery, delicious sauce, and then I tried the meatloaf.  Then THAT was the best thing I'd eaten.  The fella and I usually like to play "who got the best dish," and I'm pretty sure it was a tie at BrickTop's.  With an appetizer, bottle of wine, and two entrees, our total bill WAS a little pricey ($90ish + tip), but I don't mind paying to get a really good meal and service, and that's what we got.

YTVCM3IHkDunQkI-QrPphw.text: This was our first time visit and we had an excellent time during lunch. We came with a large group after our children's graduation to celebrate their accomplishment over the past three years of middle school. The mom of another classmate, made all of the arrangements and she made the right decision for the whole group of parents and family members. We had the whole patio area that mid day afternoon and the weather was perfect. First, the service was great ! The staff waiting on us did a fantastic job. Just at our table, every food item we ordered was delicious. From the meatloaf to the Scottish salmon and our side dishes too. First impressions do make a difference if you are coming back to a restaurant and Bricktop's made a great impression on us, during our luncheon. We will be back again !

UPfd8BkeRTOnsVfrgvpyXQ.text: This place is top notch is service and food quality!  No matter what I've eaten such as the classic chicken and waffles on lyft offered amon Sundays or the fall off the bone baby back ribs, the food is always hot, fresh and of high quality.   The service is unmatched. Anytime I've needed a special accommodation or if something was worn for with an order or mixed up, the problem is always corrected quickly and something is always taken off the bill or the.manager stops by to apologize. The really care about your experience here.   If you want to visit this place. Go on a Sunday around 2pm. This way you can enjoy thier awesome chicken and waffles and miss the church crowd that causes the waits.

jrOULtCwwPW3MKgj4mTy-g.text: I've been going to Bricktop's for a couple of years now, and it is simply good, really good!!! It became this one spot that I can get everyone to agree on, when my group of friends wants to eat completely opposite things. I absolutely love the bloody mary bar they have, I mean it includes millionaire bacon, YUM! Some of my favorite dishes are the chicken and waffles, French Toast, and California Benedict! (brunchaholic over here) Service is always so great, and fast no matter how packed the place seems.

VXcaV8KCdVoaSWqh0PnmjQ.text: This is our go to spot in Charlotte for a quality, casual meal.  Best lobster roll in town, HANDS DOWN! Cobb Salad is a must. French Dip rare and lean with horseradish sauce a must.  The Ribs are cooked to perfection and are a large portion. The surprise more for adults than kids chicken tenders are perfectly battered breast meat.  Don't try to figure out the Tavern Burger secret sauce, just enjoy it is awesome.  Only reservation is the main dining room is a bit dark and kind of dated. Sit at the bar or on the expansive patio.

lozFeT56ug3qOGJ_uZdAMA.text: Absolutely positively fantastic. I had the crabcakes with the fettuccine, I couldn't be happier. I am a tough critic and this place was excellent.    I look forward to my next visit, spectacular

BjnwYKKUnLlITAnuVLSxKg.text: Went here for our family Saturday brunch. We arrived at 11:30 and luckily we didn't have to wait too long before we got a table. It got so busy after 12pm. Our food was excellent. I recommend cob salad or crab salad. It was so fresh and healthy. I didn't feel guilty despite I was stuffed in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab salad was really good.

IkoR0Al9Xs1mqGXgKpIIlQ.text: This is my work group's favorite company sponsored meal location and on each occasion we've had good experiences with absolutely delicious food!   If you decide to go for lunch they serve several types of stacked salads which are a fun twist on an otherwise simple meal. Regardless of the meal I am there for I enjoy the variety of fish dishes they offer and light vegetable sides. The burre blanc sauce they offer is a great addition to the perfectly cooked fish dishes.   The raspberry martini is a great decision if you are adding a cocktail. It has a perfect balance of sweet to cut the liberal pour of vodka.   Sometimes the service is a bit slow but that's understandable considering how busy they get!

YstKfiOJD9uREFjOHtBt7w.text: Food is consistently good, service is usually very good and the atmosphere great for conversation.

UE_0hw3CWCzG2F02Ww6S0g.text: A complete satisfactory experience from beginning to end. The restaurant is very nice and the servers and staff are very friendly and professional.   The lunch menu offers a great selection and the prices are fair. The food was spectacular! I mean really good! My Red Snapper was perfectly cooked and the whipped potatoes are excellent. Their Chicken Milanese is also delicious. My only complain would be that I wish they'd give you bigger portion of potatoes.   The afternoon got even better when our dessert arrived. A delicious bread pudding covered in a vanilla run sauce. Wow wow wow!   We will definitely return and if they are consistently good this could be our "go-to" restaurant.

YBSrP646pYFTnUFf9J6IOQ.text: This is another long overdue review! Bricktops is one of my hubs and I go to places in Charlotte, as we're never disappointed! We have had date night, large group and group parties and celebrations here. Our friends & family now love Bricktops too! I hate that they no longer participate in restaurant week BUT we are still always in this place lol. Crab cakes are the BEST in town and I've had my share around Charlotte, no one comes close. I've tried many things on the menu and have not had one bad or disappointing item yet. Bricktops staff is GREAT and accommodating, especially when we do surprise group dinners (they'll keep the cake and the secret).   I recently chose to celebrate a new job at a close by restaurant (just to try it). After we were seated and experienced poor & slow service...my husband called Bricktops and they got us in within 15 minutes AND it was later in the evening (with a party of 8). Needless to say my whole crew up and left place 1 and enjoyed a wonderful dinner/experience at Bricktops!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The BEST crab cakes in town hands down and fall off the bone baby back ribs! Bricktops never disappoints.

tjbRsCDSlkv8rrY2vUCepw.text: Everything was delicious. Especially the fries. Hot and fresh. When there was an issue, our waitress, Rasheda took care of it. The breakfast casserole was great. Shrimp and grits good. Steak and eggs great. Chicken and waffles were on point. We will definitely be back.

z2Bz8mP7n_vksr6Cjew32Q.text: Yum! It's a busy restaurant so it is recommended to make reservations if you can. I didn't have to wait for a table, but a few people who came after me did. Service was good... We had to wait a little too be served and eventually someone else took over from our original server, and he was much better and faster! We had fish with veggies, and steak with fries. Both meals were flavored well, and done well. Very tasty! Parking is nearby and convenient, but may be a bit of a hassle on a busy night. Otherwise there meal was great! Atmosphere is adult, but good for children to dine as well.
