_AaSIijHGrb0gAnE7uo-zQ.text: So..... Good food you can, and may taste anywhere.  It's not my chance at Bricktops.  It's a consistent, solid menu, over the top menu.  EVERYTHING is fresh and immaculately prepared.  Best steaks in town... Oh the best pork chops in town.  Its all GREAT!  BUT, it's not all about the food.  HAVE A GREAT EXPERIENCE!  The service is more than over the top and separates Bricktops from EVERYONE.   Expect the unexpected and it happens at Bricktops every day. Want something that may not be obvious on the menu, ask... It may be yours, and likely will be.  The staff do not turnover, 5 -10 years tenure is typical at this wonderful place.  Why?  Everything is the BEST!  This is food and service done right!!

FcFPMRcR0_jE2c3vw_tvXw.text: Bar food in an upscale resturant. Waitress was sweet and scripted. Definitely felt as if we were at a chain restaurant. Lobster roll is very deceiving. Paying $20 for a roll that has an ounce of lobster in it with some lettuce and slaw, plus it was warmed? Coming from Maine, this was a joke. French dip was good however!

Dp5nb0AFMi-qBWfZH7n3jw.text: Tried Bricktop's for the first time for brunch with an out of town friend. It was her suggestion. We were seated outside on the patio. The complimentary bread was tasty as we waited for the main dishes. I ordered the Steak Benedict. They ordered the Shrimp and Grits and the Palm salad. In my opinion the steak Benedict had an odd taste. The roasted potatoes we ok. I had a taste of the shrimp and they were well seasoned. The highlight of the meal was watching the servers try to bring down a rain guard as it began to pour down outside.  The leftovers of my meal will be thrown out as no one at my home even wanted to give them a try. I probably will not be back unless it's by a friend's suggestion.

QKOsM7qc8o7o5BifKQuyyQ.text: The food is great, the greater thing is you can always see Charlotte basketball player and football player, football team's owner dining there too!

cvMVofFPdTnt5icAyWvoFQ.text: This was my first time going to Bricktops and I was very impressed.    The inside was classy and upscale.  We went during lunch on a Saturday, there was no wait and they were moderately busy.  The servers were wearing their Panthers gear l assume for the weekend.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an app, it was average.  I let the BF pick, honestly I wanted to check out the deviled eggs after all the reviews. Our entrees were the Palm Beach salad and a regular cheeseburger.   Oh my goodness, it was delicious! I had the palm beach salad, the presentation was beautiful I felt bad destroying it. I wish I had a pic to show.  It came with crab, shrimp, avocado, tomato and eggs. Very refreshing.  My BF ordered the cheeseburger, of course I sampled it.  The fries were amazing.  Not sure why they stole the show but they did.  They were better than hot fresh salted McDonald's fries.  I highly recommend those.  And for dessert we ordered the chocolate chip cookie. It was very rich.  A skillet baked cookie with ice cream and caramel sauce.  Also, on a side note I had the coffee with dessert too, it was very memorable. Very strong.  That may have been one of my favorite things.   I enjoyed Bricktops & would return.  Service was great, food was great.  The only concern was the price, it was on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for, right?!?

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate chip cookie dessert (almost gone!)

u5Qyuz21oo_9nVJOz-Wqfw.text: First time here and we were not impressed. The service was slow. Everything had butter involved. And the temperature was like a furnace.

LDBY4MdsPBVr1ud29QI_Aw.text: My burger was great. French fries were great also. Very nice spot. Outside patio has great views of the shopping store. However my mimosa was nasty! I will get wine next time. We had a party of 25 and service was fast

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

CZDgsXO5kZUQFCNx9Lx9IA.text: I visited Bricktops today with my mom to enjoy a nice lunch while she was in town visiting from New York.  I have heard good things and wanted to check it out.  We arrived around 12:30, and did not have a reservation.    This is a very busy place and I'd suggest a reservation and would make one next time- even for lunch!  It was a busy spot.  We were greeted by the hostess who informed us that it would be about a 30 minute wait.  The hostess was a bit snooty- but maybe she was just being focused at her job.  She could definitely smile more!  We were seated in the bar area at a booth after waiting around 20 minutes.  We started with an appetizer of spinach and artichoke dip.  It came with chips that seemed house made.  It also came with salsa which was very flavorful.  It was good dip but nothing out of the norm.  Lunch was a cheddar burger for me, and a Cobb salad for mom.  The burger was enormous!  Even big enough for my husband who always complains about the size of burgers at restaurants.  It was $14.  The Cobb salad has awesome presentation and was $16.  Both are pictured.  We finished up our meal with the cookie skillet... Which is much recommended! It was delicious and came with a huge scoop of ice cream with Carmel sauce- but we had it on the side.  It was $7.  The service was so-so.  We did not get checked on a ton considering all of the food and courses we ordered.  The bartender was our server and she did have a full bar most of the time, but maybe they should have other servers besides the bartenders during this type of volume.  The food was good.... The people we interacted with were ehhhhh.  The food made me want to return but I wouldn't say the service did.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cookie skillet with Carmel sauce on the side!
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb salad.  Pretty but my mom said the dressing had a bit too much oil.

l5FUwvoaooTYtcuy5b7aXQ.text: Food turns out to be cold. How could you even sever a cold Benedict? I wonder. Servant didn't care enough to tell the difference between soda water and regular water. Didn't ask when they refilled the thing. Really really bad experience.

M_1TR3SmcjSIbstrSkXhcA.text: Consistently great food!   Never disappointed n the service or food.  Took my girlfriends there for lunch today.  I had the Palm Salad.  My friends devoured the steak salad and Cobb salad.  We made luncheon reservations and were greeted by the hostesses staff.    A 5 star every time !

fJb59pnUQaCF6HG74WmLrQ.text: Excellent brunch spot. I come here often and the food is always fantastic. Enjoying one of my favorite things here today....Prime rib!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

89rchPNKd2AjB5rsc4gbsg.text: Lunch on Friday was great. I think BrickTops has the best burger in town! Their food is great, always consistent and comes along with a friendly and efficient staff.

OtLbZjyBl04plyjeoUQISQ.text: Our party of two received the best service during lunch today from the front desk to Anthony, our server. I've eaten there several times and love the variety of selections on the menu. I had the veggie burger this time. It is huge and so very good and moist. The deviled eggs ARE the best! Great dining experience, even during the busy lunch! Nearly every table has guests, but there were always tables available for more. We will be back soon for the black bean and chicken chili!

1R-okUDCOP-LJpPtCxjwvA.text: Great atmosphere.  Good mixed drinks and bar is of quality.  Food is on point   I'll come again!

c3TL4bbJrg7LwBT-iOJ7MA.text: My daughter took me here last night for my birthday (she's 19) we had reservations which was good because they were busy for a Wednesday night.  We were seated and greeted in a timely manner, I had a glass of wine already from the bar and my daughter ordered a sprite. We had appetizers of their bang bang shrimp, spinach artichoke dip, Caesar salad and lobster bisque. All was tasty except the Lobster bisque which has brandy in it.  It was fine for the 1st couple of spoons but after that it gets to be too much. My daughter ordered the NY Strip, I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  Her steak was perfectly cooked medium and delicious, the sea bass had a sesame gravy like sauce that I did not care for.  The stir fry vegetables that came with it were great thought and very tasty.  I took only one bite of my sea bass.  I put my plate to the side. When the server asked us if everything was ok (at least 15 minutes after we had our food) my daughter mentioned I did not like my dinner. She asked if I would like something else like dessert (not another entry) I said sure because my daughter likes their key lime pie. The manager also came by to ask about getting me a dessert. The point is the sea bass was $38 yet you offered me a $7 dessert. The server was new and sweet but she didn't come back to refill my daughter's sprite till the end of the meal, didn't know what the Cobe steak was nor what was in the BG salad.  All in all, it was just ok

ZB3g1h5b399j2X4r2JoVsg.text: Had brunch here a couple of weeks ago and I was not very impressed with the food on this visit.  The restaurant itself is very nice, cozy and clean and the service was just great.  We ordered the blackened fish tacos, grilled chicken sandwich, and a kid's meal and everything was just 'ok'.  I guess I was looking for more as I've heard lots of good things about this place and it's no doubt popular as they were overflowing with folk trying to get in......perhaps I'm missing something so I will give them another try at some point.

mIHusFeu-pvnYPJCPwCQkQ.text: This was a delicious meal. It was also quite healthy with an ahi tuna salad and all for a reasonable price. Would recommend this to anyone for a quick lunch in the South Park area.

TF16YlEGfg4T8Bg-uljsyw.text: Never heard of the place so me and my wife decided to go there last night and I have to say it was awesome. We both loved the deviled egg w/the sugar bacon. My wife does't usually eat bacon but she loved it. The prices are reasonable with what they give b/c i order ribs and they never asked me if i wanted a half or full, they gave me a full rack. The chocolate chip cookie desert was awesome. I recommend going to this place.

KghPDVg0OiEcvGCMWBk1lA.text: I really enjoy it here. The food no matter what time of the day has always great, it is nice to come to a place on a numerous occasions and know the food is going to be consistent. The millionaire bacon and deviled eggs are to die for. They have a wide variety of dinner options and a great drink menu, which have all been good that I have tried. The bistro chicken is my to go to, and the sides are all unique and delicious.

rfddeMADjJWVeIkW5M51hg.text: After we worked around a slight attitude from the hostess, the manager did an excellent job seating us at a great table on the patio.  Rob was our server and he was excellent.  I had the Trout and it was excellent.

rvTd66vx0jZq3Bsh1VX3Jw.text: This is misleading. The price range for this restaurant should really be $$$ because everything was rather expensive. I looked this place up for brunch but we didn't get a brunch menu and it wasn't past noon yet. The food was excellent however, it is kind of an upscale restaurant which my husband and I weren't aware of and showed up in jeans and t shirts while everyone was definitely in business clothing. That was awkward but the staff was still nice to us even though we stuck out like a sore thumb.

XVgCsGfnWaK4hF84ELgIew.text: We really enjoy Bricktop.   Love the ribs and corn. They also have a great chicken recipe, although I can't recall the specific dish.  My only complaint is that service can sometimes me inconsistent.

iA2WsAup9FN5aa-WetkgcQ.text: I love going to bricktops for brunch on Sundays. The chicken and waffles are so good. They are seasoned well. They also have good potatoes for brunch

YMupiLbqiUtgom9CTuV0TQ.text: The blue cheese dressing on the wedge salad is incredible.  The meatloaf is extraordinary with mashed potatoes.  The service is always friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and always make suggestions about the specials.  This is a great place to go and is very family friendly.

ri6q2GvXWHBLcUxGc4iahQ.text: I visited Bricktop's located in the upscale Southpark area of Charlotte for the first time last night with a few coworkers. Based upon this single experience, I think I'm in love.  :)  The restaurant was crowded despite it being a weeknight. I was impressed with the service provided and absolutely loved the food. I experienced the deviled eggs and sugar bacon that previous reviewers raved about. Their analyses were not in vain. Additionally, I had the prime rib and twice baked potato for my dinner entree. The steak was cooked perfectly and the potato required no modification of spice/dressings.   The restaurant is moderately priced, with most entrees in the upper teens and twenty's. However, the drinks are a bit pricey. I ordered a pineapple martini for $10. It was good, but not great... at least not for the price.  Overall, I give this place a rare 5 thumbs up!  :)

KqjmO3rdrPVnWz464Bh-Cg.text: I've ate here a couple of time and always the food was wonderful.  I've had their salmon, chicken and steak and it's always been served to perfection --not to mention always tasting just great.  I've only ate here at lunch but the service has always been extremely efficient, and polite.   The restaurant is very clean and has a great overall atmosphere.  If I had to pick a lunch place to eat this would probably be one of them; the food is just always good.

2sbGwQSc9RqD6Qammsn3TA.text: Go for the brunch. The sugar bacon and Chicken & waffles are unbelievable.

y3OuuJKDP5sa3CC0WhwgtA.text: This has to be one of the top restaurants in Charlotte. The food is always great and the staff is on point every time we dine here. (We sit at the bar almost every time).   The Bar staff is friendly and if we go to SouthPark we can count on a great time at Bricktops.

xJ9KX4SvHZhpK44STBkIOQ.text: Wandering about trying to find a place to have a drink and this was the winner. Nice big bar and opened up to the outdoor patio. Very nice and inviting. The place was crowded and I order my standard dirty martini. Bartender Sasha was right on, my tini was made to perfection. She gave us a menu and things did seem pricey but on par with most others. I just felt like drinking and had a 2nd when I spotted the Key Lime Pie and had to have a piece. They brought out this huge piece of pie and I was a happy boy. The first bite made me even happier. It was a case of come near me or touch this pie and we will have issues. Delicious. Between my martini and the pie it was perfect evening. Next time I may have to try some food, but I will have my pie first! Great service, nice atmosphere a must stop.

EkLj-PP6qfOievMtGtqOlw.text: This was my first time at Bricktops, and let's just say I wasn't impressed given that I had high expectations from reading other reviews. From the moment I sat down, I didn't feel welcome. The food was mediocre at best, but it's their service that killed it for me.  Not once were we ever checked upon and asked how our food was nor were we offered a refill of our water.  If you're looking for pretentious waiters and managers who look down at their customers, I suppose this is the place for you.

84Q1O8xk2aqo5jAfwd8jJQ.text: Love this place, especially on Sundays. Their Brunch is AMAZING!!!! The chicken and waffles for me is the best item on the menu, it's hard for me to order anything else because if I do, I feel as if I am missing out on something. I was not a fan of their grits or the mimosas, BUT the peach drink (can't think of the name) makes up for it. :) This is a perfect place for a girls brunch (which we did) or date night.

za4QGg18h5NlHvkC2jaRVg.text: It's time for a Bricktop's update - and yes, while the stars are still the same I just had to offer some info about their brunch. Because...it.is.delicious.   Yes, a friend of mine sang a pretty song about Bricktop's brunch and within days hubs and I flew over to this SouthPark staple for some goodness. Their brunchy menu is in similar style to their lunch and dinner menu - new American eclectic. Not only do they offer a make your own bloody mary bar, but they also host a variety of specialty drinks (think blood orange mimosas and bellinis by the carafe - NOM).   I've eaten the same tasty dish both brunch visits - the French Toast. Big toasty brioche slices with sides of caramelized bananas, warm maple syrup, fresh whipped cream and crispy bacon. It's delicious not at all nutritious and heavy on the portion for $11. Also, if you're feeling quite indulgent check out the bite size homemade doughnut starter - 13 sugar doughnuts with three dipping sauces (raspberry, chocolate and vanilla cream).   The brunch bill can get a bit out of hand here, especially when you start drinking your weight in mimosas, but it's worth it. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ogu3zhC0Ut4KsORh_bqFjw.text: I was initially excited about the opportunity to eat at such an establishment, considering the look, presentation, and huge crowd. But, after being told that the wait would be no more than one hour, we had to remind the hostess, on several occasions, that we had been waiting well past the original one hour promise. We were finally seated after waiting for more than an hour & a half. We were served by approximately 5 different waiters who never communicated which caused an array of problems for our table! My experience was one that I will probably never go back considering that there are several other options in the free world!

oftZCuhr2tw4kv2Bsixeww.text: I've always been a fan of Bricktops however this visit was problematic. Prices have really gone up since my last visit. One of the appeals for me was I felt dining there was a real value. Now, not as much.  I visited the bar so I could take out. I ordered roasted chicken  which is my favorite menu item. During this visit I asked for an extra helping of vegetables instead of the potatoes. The bartender told me they wouldn't sub a green vegetable for potatoes. She said potatoes were a garnish.... and she had to charge for 2nd vegetable. A garnish? Really? I left with the impression that she just didn't want to deal with my simple request.

HcObiY9gmymTd_mOpZSHrg.text: Brunch at Bricktops is probably my favorite places to meet with friends on a Sunday. The food is delicious!! We usually come in right before 12 so we can be served a mimosa soon after arriving, but have also come in around 10:30 if We have a busy day planned. The deviled eggs are served with crispy bacon drizzled with syrup-incredible. They serve excellent guacamole, but not always on the menu ( might have to ask for it). I could go on, but bottom line is that I've not had anything that I didn't love while there for brunch.

qdreYNv_8cHG--RxYwpkdQ.text: What really bummed me out about Brick tops is that by listening to the server across from us we were expecting really great service, but our server failed us. For me, dining out is an entire experience not just the food. The food was great, I orders ahi tuna, my fiance ordered a burger. I really wish our server had made a better impression of what Brick tops is really about.

dkKcHwVkUYAbUDRM0u53nA.text: One of my Charlotte favorites. I eat there all the time and it is always perfect. Their palm beach salad is wonderful and a meal by itself. The ribs are quite simply the best in town.

dR6OAIZFabO2bZL5UcRoOQ.text: Very enjoyable. We had a party of eight on a weeknight (with a reservation), and the restaurant was bustling. After a starter of deviled eggs and "millionaire's bacon", I had a full rack of baby back ribs with French fries and cole slaw. The sauce had a nice peppery kick to it... good stuff, especially with the slaw and a local beer. My wife ordered gluten-free for health reasons, but when her plate came out it was obviously not right since there were breaded onions on it. The manager quickly took it back and (we think) they prepared a whole new meal for her. It took a while, but to their credit, Bricktops did it right. We would gladly return, and I'd probably go for the ribs again!

63RpzfTBuqk_3zKHRyBInA.text: I have lived in Charlotte for 15 years and was shocked that I had never been here.  This is a very nice place for lunch.  I have been twice in a month and found the service to be warm and professional and the food to be excellent.  I'm sure the dinner menu is a bit different so I'm anxious to try it soon, too.  So far, they have some of the best fish and chips I've found.

Y15DuqK2Dmbf9rcZhimRtw.text: Been back again since my fairly recent review. Took my husband this time. I have four words for you: Get the deviled eggs.  I also got the veggie burger again. It was just as good. But seriously folks, the deviled eggs with bacon crumbles on top may be the best eggs I've ever had.

POOHjI2Uke1x1v-CxrHO6g.text: I went to Bricktops. I don't know if I went on an off night, but for as much as I paid for my meal , I expected better service. During my meal a waitress came out with a salad that she thought we ordered, but wasn't ours. She then proceeded to go to the next table and I overheard the man tell her that he didn't want it now that his entree had already come out. The next incident was my meal came out, but not my boyfriends. The waitress walked by and said she would be right back to go check on it. It took 10 more minutes for his to come out after mine had already been served. My food was not hot. It came out luke warm. Although the food was tasty there are too many negative things that happened tonight for me to want to go back to this restaurant and spend the kind of money We spent. The restaurant wasn't even busy.

eIAP4Vi5ChizuzREeCmydQ.text: Bricktops does not disappoint!   I have been here twice within the last year, and I ordered the same thing each time:  Chicke fingers!!  Why?  Because they are the best in town!  Breaded to perfection, light and fluffy on the outside and juicy on the inside.   My side of sauteed spinach for both visits was awesome too!    Love  BTS location in the heart of SouthPark with a great patio, and welcoming decor.  Service is always top notch and good looking if I must confess!  Both of my recent visits were with large parties and the service never waivered each time.

RpsK8_AN-lSKTv0AusTMsg.text: Recently one of our PAK families at at Bricktop's. It is always wonderful to find a restaurant that is helpful with food allergies. "We have been to bricktops in South Park and they say they only use olive oil as a lot of ppl have allergies. They were wonderful with our 13 month old."

sC4v5PhTUggYd-9hRGSKcQ.text: Went here for lunch today. Really like the inside of this place. Nice decor and atmosphere. They have a really delicious app with sugar bacon and deviled eggs. Definitely a must. I had the grouper for my entree. Had the mac and cheese as a side. Pretty good, except maybe a bit too much cheese.  Very tasty fish. Would love to try more of the menu and sit outside on what looked like a nice patio.

1Tuxo-wBMZJ3rdajdOsRTw.text: This is my FAVORITE restaurant! We go here about once a week! My boyfriend love the bbq ribs and the sirloin. The palm beach salad and crab cakes are my favorites! They also have some of the best sushi!! I go here now to get sushi instead of an Asian restaurant, my favorites are the Hollywood roll and the Dragon roll. Yum!! They have a beautiful patio, that can be heated and closed in or open and cooled which is perfect in any weather! The patio is where i enjoy my favorite drink (a specialty cocktail of their's) the Rosemary Greyhound! So delicious - must try- everything is good here! & The food is always consistent!

IroR-VWgYN9yHK6TGDDAYg.text: Always exciting to try a new place. Service and staff were great, very polite. We had lunch. Had 2 appetizers, popcorn shrimp, chips with guacamole. Both were good, a little pricey but decent. I had the cheeseburger which was big and cooked the way I asked. Wife had the BBQ sandwich which she said was very good. I would eat here again but at the moment I'm not thinking about when can we go back. I wasn't "wowed". For the two of us the bill was $80 including tip. Pricey for a lunch of this calibre. Oh, had tea for the drinks

LuP8fRn1EnmnCXreSFYhZQ.text: This is a beautifully decorated spot. The waitstaff is professional and on que. the manager and chefs greeted and checked on patrons. We ordered Chilean sea bass which was prepared perfectly ...Asian flare with julianned fresh veggies. The wine selection is great. This is a place we will visit again!

BXY7-rZ7cJwmjoU2nMS5VQ.text: The dessert chocolate chip cookie was unbelievably good! Solid spot for dinner with friends.

Wgunh5gBU4JsGwVqi_KJDQ.text: I love sitting at the bar. Drinks and service are awesome. The NY Strip and twice baked potato are to DIE for. Ribs are delicious as well. My husband and I will definitely be going back again and again

glTOs26PVbIGkNBah3RNqg.text: This restaurant is amazing! I've been here three times and can officially say it's my favorite place to dine in Charlotte. The food is amazing every time. Please try the salmon, steak, trout with lump crab meat, deviled eggs. You cannot go wrong with any of these. The staff was very kind, polite and we had the perfect server. He gave excellent service and was incredibly accommodating. Love this place! Already planning my next visit!

bDuX1bdqsPH9S5ymOok9nA.text: This place has really fallen off. Went there today for a work lunch, and virtually all the food was off the mark. I made the mistake of ordering the "special," which was a tuna burger that tasted like they thought it up as a way to get rid of the ahi tuna that was no longer fresh enough to serve on the salad. A couple hours after eating it, I feel less than great. The deviled eggs, normally a highlight here, tasted almost as old as the cold bacon served with them. One of us ordered a turkey sandwich and couldn't even get through half of it.   Menu has not changed much in a long time. Some of the items, like the French Dip and Cobb Salad, are very solid. But you can't get those every time.   I give it two stars rather than one because it's been pretty ok (solid three stars) the other dozen times I've eaten here, but I wouldn't rush back based on today.

kszNRqW3KirARvoaDCT3Aw.text: First time eating here and I was not disappointed.  The four stars are for service and quality of food. Did not give the fifth star due to questionable decor and fruit flies. Regular flies could be tolerated due to patio seating and the door swinging open frequently. However, fruit flies (we were seated by the bar) can only mean one thing. Back to the food. Everything was prepared very well. Coconut shrimp was excellent and the highlight item for us. Server was fantastic. Recommend highly.

o-qrJeXJQmK4_mruTemZdg.text: I am not being dramatic. This is the best meal I have ever eaten. I have ordered many a pricier steak and none have compared to the steak I had here. I ordered the steak and fries and substituted a baked potato for the fries. It came sliced and was to die for. My husband ordered a sushi appetizer and an ahi tuna entree and he was equally impressed with his food. We also had the chocolate chip cookie dessert which was great. We went for dinner on a Sunday night. I recommend reservations as they were busy. Service was good. I highly recommend Bricktops!

pcAXN7yKQ3xU7rgs4qNGPA.text: Excellent experience!! I and 2 of my best friends met at Bricktops for dinner. We made reservations in advance and were seated immediately upon arrival. Our waitress, Kim was absolutely awesome. She suggested several different wine selections for us as well as brought samples out for us to try.   The only annoying issue we had during our visit were gnats!! I'm unsure if it were due to the weather or what, but we kept swatting periodically during our dinner.   Our dinner was amazing. Their beets salad is definitely worth trying. I ordered their trout entree, while my friends order the salmon and chicken entree.   All in all, we loved the experience, the food and service were excellent. Great restaurant for dates, celebrations, or a girls night out.

9Dr2xem8dqipH68MErnvJw.text: We had dinner reservations at another local eatery just around the corner, and since we had some time, we decided to stop in for a drink.  Bar is classy, drinks wonderful but pricey .  I had the Barrel Aged Manhattan, and my friend had a Raspberry Martini. Our drinks mixed well and a great pour, glasses were full to the brim--I will never complain about too much booze!!! Our server at first was great but then seemed to be bothered--we needed a couple extra napkins due to the pour, and she even joked we needed sippy straws--hard to get that first sip with the glass overflowing--oh well.  Again, the drink was made well, but service could use improving--maybe when too big a pour, give me a side car!

zyGmnYJzD7NpPHZjQmD8_g.text: The service at Bricktops is great. A friend had her birthday brunch here. I ordered the chicken and waffles. Friends had their lobster bisque, that stood out with decent amounts of visible lobster pieces. As for the chicken and waffles, I thought that it was okay. My request for strawberries and whipped cream was met without issue. The waiter was also understanding when we wanted to taste each other's meals and provided spoons for sharing desserts.

0bVeB6bH80OnGe36ZX0bzg.text: Wonderful lunch. Great atmosphere, food, and service. Had the awesome deviled eggs with millionaires bacon, WOW!  I had the crab cake entree which was all crab and no filler; my husband had a turkey sandwich with avocado. Great lunch. David, our server was very attentive and made our first (and not last) visit memorable. Will definitely go back for dinner.

YUIP7QUPUlG88fC7yb83nw.text: It was grandparent's day which brought on taking the 11 & 8 year oldsters to lunch.  We chose Bricktop's and this is certainly a classy and well run restaurant for lunch and dinner, as well as group events.  Bricktop's has that modern wood and glass restaurant off of a very sizeable bar.  A covered and heated sun porch is just off of the bar.  Booths are comfortable and there are also table seating and nice stools along the bar.  I will risk saying that it has a masculine feel, but not stuffy old school masculine.  Women will appreciate the classiness of the place.  Wait staff are wearing white shirts with ties along with long aprons.  Adds to the class.  Wife and I really did like the lunch menu.  It was full of dinner kind of items, along with sandwiches and salads. There was grouper, crab cakes, Ahi steak, salmon and trout for sea-foods.  Ribs, steak chicken entrees.    Appetizers were pretty neat.  Nice selection of items different from the stuffed jalapenos or mozzarella sticks.  Wife and I had grilled artichokes, three half's, with a dynamite aioli dip.  Heaven.  I had the lobster roll which was delicious and not skimpy on lobster meat.  And wife had a meaty French Dip sandwich which she could not finish.  The grandchildren had some good options from the children's menu, but opted for corn dogs and fries.  But their meal included both beverage and dessert.  Dessert was choice of chocolate or vanilla ice cream and they were very generous scoops.  They even had enough to share with us.  Service was great.  Adam 809 is one to ask for.  Kept us topped up with beverages and regularly checked in with us.  Nice guy, great server.  We four left happy.

bN8N9SsxZIruvSXHW1fMag.text: Every aspect of this restaurant is top notch. The hostessss with their black dresses and pearl necklaces to the decor. The waitress recommended the new pork chop which was wonderful. Only caveat is the parking is tight spots. Location has not changed

NqGo63YLVa2pvFj0LvNCPQ.text: I had an appointment at drybar and was really early so decided to take the kids and eat a quick lunch. Our service was incredible. The wait staff went above and beyond accommodating us and helping with a left behind item from my five year old. It was such a nice gesture - and they were all wonderful. Thank you for helping us and for the great food. Will be back.

8pY8nbQapFwRHh3NWATnXg.text: I have to give Bricktops a shout out. This place has become our favorite restaurant. You really can't order anything bad. They have great sushi, steaks and salads. The service is always superb. There are so many bad restaurants in Southpark that we stick with Bricktops. You won't be disappointed!

wD528zFznbhJQ5DNSuscIA.text: Really lovely lunch - a great menu with lots of light options full of flavor. I ordered the palm beach salad and the presentation was great - the flavors even better. Highly recommend for a nice lunch out.

RICaXyTeRoxSH60IiujZjg.text: Bricktop's is an excellent place to go for lunch! I ordered the lobster roll with fries. Everything was fantastic! My mother ordered the Cobb salad and she said it was delicious. I have to agree with her, I took a bite of it myself and it was wonderful and I will definitely order that next time.

ca92sMTUZYNTqTTFXXN5QA.text: I am someone that is very particular when it comes to sushi, and I have to say, Bricktop has some of the best sushi I have had in Charlotte. So unique and fresh. The atmosphere is very classy yet inviting and the staff here is so friendly and recommends the best options on the menu that cater towards your foodie desires. This place is somewhere I have surprise birthday parties all the time, they are so helpful all the time!

5P1_QNE92ouH4fptDT0JhA.text: This place has Capital grille prices, Applebee's quality of food and The staff was fighting with each other behind the bar. The staff is dressed like they work at Capital or a upscale place but give terrible service. The quality of food was of a frozen microwave dinner honestly. I have no idea how this place has so many great ratings. If the prices matched the food I wouldn't be writing this. But nothing about this place makes sense.

2jrWZMqGXmdnE6C0ZaBMng.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  There is nothing here that is not outstanding.   The food is amazing.  The service and atmosphere are also amazing.  Today, I met my friend Dan and we were seated in a cozy booth next to the bar.  It was a spot that I could have occupied for hours because it was just so comfortable.  In fact, we were there for a few hours!   I had the chicken dish with yummy mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach.   It was better than just five stars!   This was a refreshing lunch because it was full service, the food was served on real plates, and it was not a fast order at the counter experience.   We need MORE of these!   The price you pay may be a little bit more than the fast counter restaurants , but you really do get what you pay for!   Bricktop's has earned its reputation in Charlotte and If you haven't been here, you are missing out.   Three thumbs up!

SSC67m0pbbdSfMWfGOyx6A.text: This is the best restaurant in Charlotte! We love the staff and management here. The food is outstanding whether for brunch, a causal business lunch or a date night dinner. They're also wonderful with families and kids. Great cocktails and I highly recommend the Palm Beach Salad. Simply wonderful!

5W4NslZ2RmcfbtISnEJKnQ.text: Tried them for the first time and the brunch was great. The French toast was amazing and the lobster bisque was amazing as well. My only disappointment was the eggs. The eggs were too salty for some reason. As I couldn't finish them. Overall great experience. Great servers and staff.

gh2Nosl_w8wfu4wzYDgKug.text: Reliable and delicious.   We have dinner here about twice a month.  Reservations recommended.   Lots of variety on the menu, and everything I have ever ordered has been good.

-FqXe-reNueCU7XPSrdBuQ.text: Excellent restaurant.  Never had even an average meal here...always top notch.  The burgers, the ribs, the Prime Rib, and that wonderful French Dip sandwich for lunch...oh man.  Hell even the chicken tenders are outta this world.  Shoulda went here today...

ryN2eX0eT7Hx5GQB4X86vg.text: I can honestly say this was the worst steak I've ever had. I ordered the American Kobe sirloin and fries. The meat, and I use that term lightly, was definitely not sirloin. It had that cheap mystery lunch meat flavor that you would find in a bad taco and was more fat that beef. Since there was only about six ounces, mostly fat, I only got about two bites and that was more than enough to feel sick. At $28 a plate that's $25 too much.  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was nice. It just isn't enough to make up for the bad food and outrageous prices!

NB7d430yqw6mbRtdf-Rvcw.text: I am a fan of the menu of this restaurant. The food deserves four stars but the service is 3 stars based on my two experiences there.   My husband and I really enjoy the food. We like the Deviled Eggs and the Millionaire Bacon, the meatloaf, Chicken Milanese and the ribs.   We've had a mixed experience with the service. The first time we sat at a booth in the bar area and had FANTASTIC service. That server really set the bar high for subsequent servers. The second time we dined we ate in the dining room and  the service was adequate but not great. There was a couple sitting across from us and apparently the whole entire staff knew the woman of the couple and congregated at their table during our entire dinner which was  distracting because they were laughing and talking as if they were at a party.  With the restaurant practically full, I wondered how they had so much time to congregate. Did they not have other customers to attend to?  Our waitress was adequate but really busy and when  she came to our area, she spent a lot time chit chatting with the couple instead of checking on us at regular intervals.  She had various helpers bring items but  after our flatware was removed with our appetizer dishes, we had to request new  utensils. We had a hard time flagging our her down when we needed something, she  just always seemed in hurry. We had to request drink refills, they were not offered. We had to request bread, it was not offered. We felt like she was not attentive,  like  we were an afterthought, not really a priority. Also the timing was off on a couple of courses. My husband got his salad long after the appetizer but about two seconds before his entree.    Since the second visit was for my husband's birthday, I was somewhat disappointed that service was not as good as the first time. This experience did color my perception of the restaurant somewhat. I left my normal tip since service was not horrendous, but I was not thrilled with it either. Since we had a good initial experience,  I am willing to  attribute this to just a fluke.  I would come here again because of the menu. But if we experienced lackluster service again, I would be not be inclined to return.  Servers need to understand that good service adds to the quality of the experience. It is not just about the food. If I just wanted good food, I would do take out or cook at home. I want the the opportunity to relax, have good meal and be properly attended.  UPDATE: I did notify the management of this restaurant about the second visit. The manager acknowledged that he had had to speak to the servers about congregating at  the couple's table to chat before. Apparently, they are frequent diners at the restaurant and a lot of the staff know them. He apologized and sent a gift card to be used at a future visit. We had already decided that we wanted to return there at some point in the future- they have a brunch menu that looks good- so this was a nice gesture. But if we get seated near that couple again, I am going to ask for another table. :-)

e3nVxFFeLQKL72FXFN0JSg.text: This afternoon I took my daughter to lunch with high expectations!  I had heard great things from friends and colleagues - in the "hospitality industry". The appetizer was great but we  had to send the meal back which was corrected - then okay. Our issue - the customer service/waiter was horrific! Did not check on our table as he did with others. But mostly when we advised we were unable to finish our meals - he brought two boxes...we had to ask for bags to carry out and THEN he rushed my daughter asking: "do you want that?" Extremely disappointing I suggest management have him enroll in diversity training class. Hopefully he will learn that "We All" carry the same money and the color is GREEN! Will not return nor refer....

I0g1WxbQTh_4Fl_DyDDdbw.text: Just a great place. Good menu, terrific service. We were there for a late lunch and enjoyed everything about it. Love the bar! We'll definitely be back

uIBNhC3E3lxaErIk9zNfMQ.text: Brunch Review - great atmosphere and friendly service.   Homemade donuts are phenomenal! Had the egg casserole which was flavored well. Only gripes were the over salted potatoes and the lack of flavor in my friends chicken and waffles.   Would definitely return for brunch.

2Ar7gkH8RZLdNkswhFljtw.text: After all the great reviews I guess I expected a little more but it didn't happen. The atmosphere is nice, relaxing, very country club-ish and so were the people on the day we were there. Everyone else was over 50 and it seemed like that kind of crowd. There was no background music playing, which was very noticeable.   The wait staff were very good, friendly, cheerful and quick. The menu looked delicious but the prices really didn't. My wife had the ahi tuna burger which was just the, ground up ahi tuna with fillers for $16. I had the French Dip sandwich which was good (but also $16) and the au jus had the distinct taste of butter. So much so that I thought the pasted baguette was buttered but it wasn't.  I don't think we'll be back. But hopefully other people will enjoy it. It just wasn't for us.

oQ3Fb5VwmwBEcV4XdbMhHw.text: I stopped in with my wife for lunch.  This was my first time dining at Bricktop's (just moved to Charlotte from Chicago).  My overall score for Bricktop's is 3.5.  Wedge Salad: 4.  Very good, I liked the chopped raw onion touch.  They even split it for us, no hassle.  BBQ Chicken Flatbread: 3.  Solid flavors.  They use cream cheese on it, which I didn't mind, but a few pieces had a little too much of it.  Veggie Flatbread: 4.  Good Mediterranean flavors, I preferred this to the BBQ Chicken Flatbread.  Ambience/Space:  3.5.  Casual & very comfortable.  They also have a nice outdoor patio under a canopy that would be great on cooler days/nights.    Service: 3. The employees were pleasant when dealing with us, but I sort of got the feeling they didn't want to be there.  Understandable, considering it was Labor Day.  No one enjoys having to work on holidays.  Side note: A waiter walked by with some sushi rolls that looked very good.  Will probably give them a try next time I visit Bricktop's.

Hxr3aYGovzI0zx3y_NfH4w.text: Nice restaurant ... Very upscale ... High dollar ... You need to dress well and make sure you are hungry ... Beautiful ambience and the waiters are awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

CwZWUkXf0ic-AkUgylrROQ.text: Ribs, barbecue chicken flatbread, crab cakes, cast iron cookie.  Best in town

AMXwHySMz9N2uNRJ6wbEQQ.text: We randomly decided to check out Bricktop's last Sunday as a last minute plan since we had to hit up the mall for some Christmas shopping.  I have been meaning to try them out for awhile but just seem to forget about it!  Anyway, we were there during brunch hours and the menu was fabulous, not to mention the plates of fluffy french toast and waffles that we saw passing by our table...BUT, we didn't go with a typical brunch.  We both ordered burgers.  I don't feel like I have earned the right to review this restaurant since we ordered burgers only...no apps, no dessert, no drinks, nothing special.  BUT--I HAD to give a shout out to the burgers at this joint.  I had the veggie burger and it was a DELIGHT!  It was by far the BEST veggie burger I have ever had.....and I have had a TON of them.  The waitress told us they make everything fresh in house and it was so obvious.  The veggie burger had such flavor and it was so moist!  It was falling apart a little bit but I didn't really mind because it was so good!  It was served with their french fries which were thin cut and very good as well.    My husband ordered their cheeseburger and he put it on the list of his top 3 burgers ever!  He has several dives he goes to in NY for a good burger so the fact that this burger made his top 3 list is truly amazing and speaks volumes for this restaurant.   I CANNOT wait to go back and try more of their menu items because if they are getting the burgers right then I am hopeful that other things will be amazing!!!!

0WKvXZXmfkgwg-bphZdzXA.text: Wasn't exactly sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised at how good everything was.  The spinach dip was so good someone at the table was licking the bowl with her fingers.   I had the meat loaf with mac and cheese side; lets say its the best I've had at any restaurant ever! Someone in my group ordered the fish tacos and they were really rood but the kale salad, maybe not so much. We all were happy with our meals.  Thank you!

r0VcIAbjdqVnKgpNKUO_1g.text: Deviled egg app with a side of sugared bacon was delicious!  We crumbled the bacon & sprinkled it on the egg. Yum!  I had their signature chicken dish which was tasty but unevenly seasoned. It was blackened, which I liked, but one bite would be salty & the next very peppery. A side of creamed spinach was good but rather rich. Hubby had fresh fish which was fine (I thought it a little plain) and my daughter had blacked tuna which she loved. We enjoyed sitting outside. I wanted to stroll around in the surrounding shops afterward but was surprised they closed at 7pm.

x6lKPE-mQ8MwPwYDYstcPw.text: Hi there , just a writing a  short note had a wonderful time at Bricktop , fantastic service and the the ribs , were to die for ..... Thank you for all involve ... a truly memorable eating experience !!!!

s_XIIl0CNvaOjqVzx5sCkQ.text: Perfection!  The food was excellent, booth seating is extremely cool, the bar is gorgeous.  We had the grilled artichoke appetizer and for lunch, the jumbo chunk crab cakes which were heavenly and the "upscale" chicken strips which were prepared tempura-style, light and fluffy.    There are definitely things I could pick on, such as the lack of a True chocolate-based dessert, but they are minor flaws.  And they went above and beyond with detail such as having the nicest bathrooms of any venue in Charlotte.   Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bricktop Sign

L2rqHwfIk1TABH_BUhfCfQ.text: I came to BrickTops for my birthday with 4 other friends. We started off with the deviled eggs and millionaire bacon, they were delicious! Also had the lobster bisque and that was really yummy! For the entree, I ordered the crab cakes and substituted the cole slaw for a loaded baked potato. The crab cake had good flavor, but the portion was extremely small for $30 and the baked potato came out cold. One of my friends ordered the prime meatloaf which was divine!!!! The meatloaf was delicious! However it was a very small portion, it was more like a meatball instead of a loaf. She also ordered a side of mashed potatoes that tasted like instant potatoes; which wasn't that great, she also added a side of mac & cheese which was pretty good.  Another friend ordered fish tacos with a side of fries. The tacos were actually pretty good. Had nice flavor to them, similar to a blackened taste.  My third friend ordered the chicken Milanese; the chicken was crispy and tasted like perfection. However the dish was supposed to come with a side of Alfredo but the kitchen "ran out", instead of telling us that there wasn't any pasta, they just neglected to tell us and sent the dish out without it. Boo!  The last dish ordered was the bacon cheeseburger with fries . It looked really good but I didn't get a chance to taste it. Overall the food was pretty good but I would not go back because it wasn't worth the price.

Hjy44WxRHN1UuXXgF4sfCg.text: We went for dinner on a Thursday night. Very good food and service. Great crab cakes- fresh and not full of breading; it  actually consisted of real fresh crabmeat!  The ribs were delicious and falling off the bone. Full of flavor. Will definitely be back and recommend to others.

irFs3ilhrDHkuRSvEcADaw.text: Went here for a company lunch and all the food was delicious. It was pricey and I thought the appetizer portions were very small for the price. Also was disappointed they don't serve bread before the meal. Other than that, the food was spectacular. I tried lots of appetizers - tempura shrimp, spinach artichoke dip, and candied bacon were amazing. I had fish tacos with mahi mahi and they were to die for. The fish melted in my mouth. Peach Bellini was good, Mac and cheese was amazing, chocolate chip cookie and gingerbread were all perfect. Food was some of the best I've had. This place only lost points for no bread and small portion size for appetizers.

OA_i6DM0lW1RPH--5r4Mpw.text: Fantastic Food and Service - Need to know who to ask for if you want great service (you know what that means!  Should I name the great ones?)  Prime Rib (Ordered "as RARE as Possible!!!  Served as rare as possible...  Every Time!!!) with raw Horseradish - PERFECT!!!  Not not look at my photos if you are _____ ish about Blood and Bones!  Bread - Being very smart Bricktop's gets there bread from Nova's Bakery!  Ribs - Almost every time I get Baby back Pork Ribs - Bricktop's makes them Perfectly!  BBQ Sauce for a simple sauce this one is very good!  Fries - One of My favorite places to get Fries!  BBQ Sauce - Excellent!!!  Dessert - Keylime Pie with a Thick Macadamia and I think Graham Cracker Crust - The BEST Keylime Pie I have ever eaten!!!  One of the Best Desserts in Charlotte!

M7xzPGZKk8286WVeqhKvrA.text: Stopped into Bricktop's for lunch one day so that I could use a gift card I had won.  Had never been, but a gift card is as good a reason as any.  We arrived at around 12:30pm on a weekday and here's your first pro-tip:  Dress smart.  We were all wearing jeans and we stuck out like a sore thumb.  Definitely more a business casual-type place.  We had to wait approx. ten minutes to be seated, but when we were, we were greeted warmly by our waitress.  She took our drink orders and gave us a run-down of the specials.  My co-worker and I decided on the fish tacos, while another co-worker went with the beef/mashed potato/carmelized onion flatbread.  It took about 15 minutes or so for our food to arrive, and while waiting, I checked out the jukebox.  It. Is. Awesome.  I queued up some MJ, Coldplay, Oasis, Verve, Bruce, Frank Sinatra, and Billy Joel.  Our food arrived and we dug in.  Two tacos came two to an order and the fish of the day (and everyday) was mahi-mahi.  The tacos were really tasty.  The spicy salsa was right on and there was some decent brown rice on the side.  My flatbread co-worker enjoyed her pizza, but found it to be a tad salty.  For dessert, we decided on the cookie.  Delicious.  And now I know why they keep it in the skillet (if they took it out, it would just ooze everywhere).  Bricktop's is a little outside of my normal price-range.  While the tacos were good, I don't know that they were $14.00 good.  On the other hand, I think that dessert is worth the $7.00.  I'll come back, but it will be a special occasion.  And rest assured, I will be kickin' out the jams on the jukebox!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. fish tacos with brown rice

451eKaLriD7rpIsI51IfJA.text: This was my first visit but my GF suggested it after we'd done some shopping for furniture ; it's one of her favorites and we were also squeezing in a quick celeb for her new job!  They have a Butter Crab Sushi Roll - yeah I'd never encountered such a sushi roll but let me tell you - I will again!  I have rarely EVER felt euphoria from eating many foods but that Butter Crab Roll is amazingly good! The Deviled Eggs w/ Millionaires Bacon- so, so good; Beet Salad w/ Goat Cheese and Rock  Shrimp Tempura, great. My cocktail, The Winchester and  new to the menu, was ... lovely!  Gin based with about 8 ingredients and a sprig of fragrant rosemary!  Though I did not try their steak or Ahi Tuna, my GF said it was great so I'm looking forward to getting my husband there for dinner on a day that does not exceed the normal heat index and we can enjoy the patio.  Our server was Dani ( thank you for the sushi suggestion!) and she was an absolute pleasure.   Money and time well spent!

ys8Z5b3y70EtSfPz7XX4Xg.text: This was definitely a more upscale place than I had expected. I had just arrived in town on a business trip and had jean shorts and a t-shirt on. I felt under dressed for the restaurant. Other than feeling a little out of place everything was good.  I got the crispy chicken salad which came piled high in a cylinder shape. It was kind of odd, but different. Once my fork stabbed into it, the salad fell on the plate and mixed itself up. The chicken was in large chunks and the rest of the toppings were a good mix. I really liked it with the buttermilk ranch dressing.   Our waiter was really nice and sitting outside on a beautiful day was the perfect start to a great weekend.

RDS2aLeCCOhR_gMASE8JSA.text: I have been here many times and many times have ordered the Steak and Eggs, and for the most part the eggs have never been cooked correctly, in fact I have returned 3 times to have brunch on the management and the eggs were still not cooked properly. The sad thing about this place, is they have Zone Service and IF done correctly works well, but in this case the server takes my order writes down over easy eggs and then the cook ( yes not Chef) makes the eggs. gives them to what appears to be an expediter, who then gives them to a server (not our because of zone service) and serves them to me and not one person realized the eggs were hard instead of over easy. Well you may ask why the 3 stars, well I have been here for anything but eggs and the food has been good and the wife likes the food too and drinks are half way decent. There is a diner I go to who always cooks the eggs correctly and I am friends with the owner and I asked him how is it you see over easy and I get over easy but I go to this place and have never had them cooked correctly. He said I ask my cooks before I hire them, Do you like Eggs? Have you cooked eggs? he says that's the key, if they don't like them or cook them how can you make eggs for someone else. So is this the reason they can not cook eggs heck I dont know. I just know if you can not cook an egg you have problems and then to have the expediter and the server bring it out without looking if everything is correct and still serve it, hopeless.

73GQIwQyB7W8e_JQmbfunQ.text: So this week I stayed at a hotel close to this restaurant. I ended up going in there because it was within walking distance and I did not have to drive. Boy am I glad that I did. The place is quaint and awesome. I ended up Eating at the bar with one of my coworkers. The bartender was quick and attentive and made some recommendations off the menu. I was very happy to see that the menu had a lot of different choices depending on my taste for the night. Both me and my coworker ended up ordering the Aji tuna platter. It was outstanding.  The entire atmosphere and the feel for the restaurant was cool hip and modern. Menu was very good and I would highly recommend anybody stopping in here to order any of the food as it all looks great as it passed by us.

r9izxuGfJvIPnLdMesueCw.text: Sometimes I wonder why I even keep doing this Yelp review thing, when all I really need to do is follow the reviews of my favorite Yelper Michael W. I agree that this Southpark restaurant is indeed outstanding, beginning with its very professional dressed wait staff,  with men dressed in ties and black vests and ladies, in black dresses and white pearls.  The leather seated booths are also both stylish and comfortable. Most importantly, the food is exceptional.  Despite all of this,  it is still casual dining however and is a splurge for most of us (my wife's and my lunch bill with tip ran $67). Also sound the beverage price gouging alarm (soda and iced tea are $3), which is always a major gripe of mine.   We started things off with the highly recommended Deviled Eggs with Bacon appetizer for $10. It was a beautifully plated dish with six half deviled eggs around a mound of bacon, which was more like candy as it was encased in carmelized sugar and honey. I can see why it is so popular but it was a bit too sweet for us  My wife ordered the Lobster Roll with spinach at $20. The lobster was plentiful and tender. The spinach was perfectly prepared.   I went with the chicken and spinach dish for $16 which was an exceptional creation with two chicken breast halves pan seared and sliced thin served with a savory creamy white sauce. The creamed potatoes were unfortunately only lukewarm, a common problem. Overall though it was a great dish.   The $3 tea was also very good and refilled faithfully by our excellent server Adam. The bathrooms were clean and the sanitation rating was a 95 . A small dessert list is offered with choices at $10 each.  By the time we left at noon, the dining room was nearly full. I guess I wasn't the only one who read Michael's review. We'll defintely be back.

ITW6vt3NjEhh_il2SM6ppA.text: Great spot for Sunday dinner. We honestly forget about this gem but glad we remembered today!  The deviled eggs and bacon appetizer are a hit! The bacon leaves you licking your fingers from the carmelized sugar.   I was torn between the salmon and the Palm Beach salad. I went with the Palm Beach Salad and I made the right choice! OMG! The poached shrimp and crab meat on top of avocado looked as good as it tasted! The greens were on the side and the shrimp, crab and avocado were off to the side which caught me by surprise. I skipped the tomatoes because I'm not a fan. This salad was amazing.   I tasted a friend's side of creamed spinach and it was divine!  Too full for dessert.   Great spot and definitely worth a try!

dr27_Fq2ohPNw-ygFX2uqg.text: I love Bricktop's because it's usually nothing here that isn't delicious. Every time is a new experience if you try something different. My girls and I had a 9pm reservation but didn't get there till 9:30!!!! They close at 10 but that wasn't a problem.  Our server(forgot his name) was extra helpful, gave us suggestions, which were on point and was pretty funny. The great think about it is when you're with a group each of you can order something different and take little nibbles off of each others plates and it's like you've tasted the entire menu....well at least that's what WE do!!! We had the tastiest drink called The Prickly Pear and it had just the right amount of alcohol, some said too strong but not for me!!!! Remember I said they closed at 10pm well we left at I believe almost Midnight and not one person complained or rushed us out. When it's good food , good drinks and great conversation, time really does fly by!!! Crap just remembered I didn't take pics of our food.  We had... Deviled Eggs Shrimp Wedge Salad Trout Chicken and Fettuccine  Crab Cakes Coleslaw

WC3e0mwSzUj67bCx95J5PQ.text: Bricktop's! One of my fav CLT Eats!  Don't let the cosmic sans logo treatment from the outside (sorry I'm in advertising and I notice these kind of things) trick you. Bricktop's is a great semi-formal restaurant in Charlotte!! Most people think it looks like a sports bar from the outside, but trust me it's not! I absolutely love this place! You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   The crab cakes are lush and full of crab, the Ahi Tuna is fresh and delightful, and the RIBS are a must! I would never actually get ribs out, but a few years back the server recommended that my husband get them. OMG they are amazing! They fall off the bone, and are so tender - full of flavor! They are a must. We get them every time!  And, most recently, we went here with my brother-in-law and his wife. He got the lamb chop, which can be dry, but not here. It was full of flavor and one of the favorite meals at dinner.  Plus, to top things off, service is always on point!  If you haven't tried Bricktop's yet, stop what you're doing and get here!

01Q56_dTEKBeOshxy4_Rww.text: I tried Bricktop's for brunch and I was pleasantly surprised by the entire experience. We left terrace cafe because of the extremely long wait time and was seated immediately at Bricktop's. Our waitress, Alexis, was amazing. She was patient with us and answered our many questions. I ended up getting the bistro chicken and it was delicious. All of the flavors worked together and made a meal that actually seemed somewhat healthy. I must add that their fries are to die for!!!!!! We both grabbed a mimosa because you can't have brunch without one. I will definitely be back to bring my friends and to get more fries!

3jm0quExpqGmBtMiPtzhWQ.text: TGIF and what a long week it was. What better way to decompress than with a few margaritas.   First time at BT at the recommendation of a friend that frequents this spot for their Prickly Pear Margaritas which according to bartender Kimmie the make their puree in house then soak that in some tequila and out comes this beautiful bouncing baby margarita. I'm not a margarita fan or tequila but this wasn't half bad and it sneaks up on you like a thief in the night. Ok maybe not the best analogy but you get the point lol.  What's the next best thing that comes along with drinks other than.....drum roll.....OYSTERS!!! Decided to order oysters 2 wats, toasted and raw. Not a big fan of the roasted since i feel like it takes away from the natural flavors but hey it was an experience. The raw oysters were nice and fresh. I mean, you chuck them then serve not to much work there but have to admit they were on the smaller side than I'm use to. Another friend ordered the  Deviled Eggs with Bacon which i don't eat pork but he knocked them out pretty quick so i can only assume they were great. FYI they have sushi too so yeah that was also fresh and delicious.  With all these great things being said, my only critique would be the drinks. A friend asked for a mixed drink which he gave the bartender the ingredients but the execution wasn't the best.  Overall really great experience, the environment is very old school white collar but we met a few really cool folks at the bar so i recommend sitting their and mingling lol. Cheers!

tfED_PHeUJmMAtjXroGjog.text: Bricktop's  told us my favorite place to eat when I go to SouthPark mall. The prices are higher considering you get a generous portion of food. For my visit I ordered the meatloaf with creamy mashed potatoes it was very delicious. For desert I finished off with a chocolate chip cookie drizzled with ice cream baked in a cast iron skillet. What a great way to end a meal!

qOOSiDy7wj9cYwIbfP8q8g.text: This place was absolutely fantastic. My friends and I visited Bricktop's again because we had dreams about their food 3 years ago. They did not disappoint. Get any meat from this place and you will not regret it. I ordered a slab of BBQ ribs and went straight to heaven. It was a bit spicey, but I like it that way. Stay away if you cannot handle spice. Nick, our waiter, recommended the best cocktail I have ever had - Basil Bourbon Blood Orange. I liked it so much I ordered 2 before the night was over. That was a first for me, but this was most certainly the start of many times returning to Bricktop's.

a1pZuGOUvzAgNgFwUFbF8w.text: Came for a business dinner.  Atmosphere is not and quiet perfect for business meetings.  We started with Sushi, a must try!  It was delicious.  I had a hearty starter salad and then perfectly cooked and seasoned salmon for my main course with stir fry veggies.  It was a wonderful meal!  I will be back!

A23wBvUhs_nyJ9ofZC5SxA.text: This was my first visit and was chosen because of its reviews on Travel advisor and Yelp.  Bricktops can be seen from street in Specialty Shops SouthPark upscale shopping area. Ample parking in front of a well lit area.   As you enter there is seating along the walls in front of the hostess stand with soft mood lighting.  I was seated in a booth in front of a TV playing a Houston Astros ballgame next to a bar with an extremely loud group of customers.    I had a great view of the retail shops from my vantage.  I indulged in a beet and goat cheese salad with vinaigrette  and Chicken Milanese.  It was all mouthwatering.  I ventured to request a dessert menu and had to refuse it when my waitress returned. There was absolutely no space for another bite.     This was an enjoyable evening all around.  When visiting again, I'll definitely return.
