d-JXfHzMSLtCXg_KZoCh9Q.text: Always great service and food is consistent. Excellent place to take clients or a date.

ZiHnR1636Uuo3pTYbgVw1A.text: We had a really good group dinner at Bricktop's.  Even for a group of 16, the service was attentive and prompt.  Our reserved table was ready for us and we were seated on time.  Our appetizers, tempura shrimp and deviled eggs, were very good.  The shrimp was perfectly fried and the dipping sauce had a great taste.  The real treat was the entrees.  I had the chicken, creamy mashed potatoes, and sauteed spinach.  All cooked perfectly and very tasty.  The deserts were also very good.  I am very glad we tried Bricktop's.  With it being so close to my job and home, it is a great spot.  I look forward to bringing my wife back.  It was a really good meal.

0rP3w-IgTr4vCTmjXAQvsA.text: I usually love coming here, especially for the martinis. However, this trip was a completely different experience. My dirty martini did not taste good, clearly missing the dirty component and heavy on the vermouth (or whatever). A different bartender "fixed" it by re-mixing my drink with olive juice instead of remaking the entire drink. This did not make the drink better and, to compound the issue, no one took my food order after waiting for 10-15 minutes. Needless to say, I made a special trip over here for a martini and a certain dish and walked away extremely disappointed.

MkJgDSFlXqXkJbTBmIFi9g.text: Ate at Bricktop's for a business dinner today and got to try a plethora of different things; overall I was a fan of the food but not super blown away. -BBQ Chicken flatbread: this was decent; the chicken was juicy and the barbecue sauce added good flavor but the flatbread wasn't that crispy and flopped under the toppings -Tempura shrimp: very crispy on the outside but the shrimp were still juicy. The sauce was similar to bang bang shrimp from Bonefish/ Cheesecake Factory and was very tasty -Spinach dip: came with tortilla chips and salsa; all pretty standard- not bad but just average -Millionaire's bacon: great!! Pretty sweet but the saltiness of the bacon still came through, everyone LOVED this at my table. -Simple greens salad: exactly what you would expect; good portion for a salad but WAY too much dressing for my taste (I asked for it on the side but received it poured all over the top) -Crab Cakes: highlight of my meal! The lump crab was awesome and didn't need a lot of spice/sauce because it was so good on its own. The coleslaw it came with was average and the portion was fairly small but the taste was on point. -Chocolate chip cookie skillet: topped with ice cream and a good end to the meal. It wasn't extraordinary but it was a warm baked chocolate chip cookie topped with ice cream...you can't make it taste too bad -Key lime pie: everyone at my table thought this was WAY too tart and I agree. The graham crust was good but if you don't love key lime pie I would avoid for sure.   Our server was okay and the food took quite awhile to come out for each course, so I wouldn't advise eating here if you're in any sort of time crunch. Definitely a better place to relax and enjoy conversation without having to worry about being rushed out which is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake Entree with Coleslaw

WS8rZl66dSEDwkFhOMQ7nw.text: Kale and Quinoa salad refreshing. Nice clean bright environment. No waiting for Sunday brunch. Crabcakes were meaty but not too flavorful. The deviled eggs and bacon was a bit too sweet. Savory egg filling would've been a better contrast to the sweetened bacon. Overall, I might dip around the corner to O'Hop for about half the price. .

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

rxnkSZlVWJ25ZoFQIu-8Kg.text: I don't know, maybe it was just a lot fancier than we expected, but the food was mediocre and the service was poor.  We won't be back.

kga2kbQC-lvtIAdTnLECBw.text: Not often I give 5 stars!  Went once for a friend's 10-guest birthday dinner in June 2015 and my gf ordered the BEST crab cakes I've ever had. My grouper with crab meat was phenomenal as well. Great mashed potatoes.   Martinis were superb (not that I go to restaurants for the drinks).  Service was superb as staff did a great job keeping the drinks flowing and serving all food at once for 10 ppl on a Saturday night.   I can't wait to bring my family here for a visit!

58yxIaQkQDQpAhCzXpWGlg.text: This is a place that never disappoints. Great appetizers, tasty drinks, and amazing salads. The deviled eggs are legendary! I get them every time I go. The staff is attentive and the atmosphere is cool, casual, and stylish. I have a great time every visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small plate / appetizer-Tempura shrimp

QnNAWywk4Qnr4x9uK5kt-Q.text: If you are rich, older, and live in South Park- you will love it and fit right in. Was that too much? Seriously, the food is decent and it packs a crowd but I am the only one here that thinks this place is overpriced? I was contemplating the chicken tenders with fries but priced at $18 I wondered if the waiter would cut it up and feed it to me as well. Sadly, he didn't so I settled for the burger which was cheaper. Price isn't an issue for me, I will spend the $$ on a good meal, but Bricktop's just doesn't justify it. For dessert I had the warm chocolate chip cookie a la mode. I love a good dessert! It was pretty large, but a little too chocolatey and why is there NEVER enough ice cream attached to a dessert? The ratio was 4:1 cookie to ice cream. :(  The decor was nice with large booths and the place fills up quickly. If you look around to check out the clientele it is a lot of ladies who lunch with too much botox. I had to ask myself, where am I? If you plan a trip to your dermatologist's office soon and still have some cash to blow, stop by Bricktop's.

s6AI_uEkIuDYcXZWFq_xkA.text: Excellent food, no -- excellent cuisine.  Excellent service -- well, except for paying the bill.    They don't accept Discover.  That's okay.  The wait-person came back with the check, after my attempt to pay with Discover, and curtly stated, "We don't take Discover," as he drops the card on the table.  Hmmm.    His dropping the card on the table must have been unintentional, as he and I discussed.  But after careful contemplation of the way he refused the Discover Card, I think it was a passive-aggressive act, although not a totally conscious one (perhaps).  Management, please take note.  After having expended the effort to write that, I'll be back to try another excellent meal.

lA9bi5kZWnhNUVcuYEJ4hw.text: I'm not big on writing reviews but when you have a meal this superb it's hard not too! Everything I ate was absolutely fantastic, full of flavor and well worth any amount. Granted, I did dine during restaurant week which meant 4 courses for $30. But I would and will gladly come back as often as I can! The meal started with Tomato soup, followed by their sausage flatbread. Both were perfectly portioned and left me excited about what was next. The Ribs were fall off the bone tender, and sides of mac and creamed spinach were the perfect compliments. At this point were both stuffed and fully satisfied when the best looking skillet chocolate chip cookie EVER was sat in front of us. It's hard not to make room and it was worth every painful bite!   Considering it was a very busy time for the restaurant our experience there did not suffer one bit. We arrived on time for our reservation and were immediately taken to our seats. Our server was on her game and they even worked as a team to ensure every guest needs were taken care of. If you had any doubts about this place before, hopefully I can ease your mind by saying go and experience this place for yourself. You won't regret it!

-SHfZrDjzRloAQjgg_uymw.text: Pretty good place for brunch. I go here just for the candied bacon and deviled eggs. Not too fond of some of the other items I've had here. It's hit or miss sometimes with the way it is prepared. A few times I've ended up with soggy food or really poorly made latte.

AuLN7H6ci0j8qbFRwpHnww.text: Excellent service! I'm from out of town so this was my first time here.  Tried the deviled eggs and bacon appetizer and followed advice of the waiter to add the Melinda's hot sauce...it was perfect and a lot for one person...better to share with one or two others. Salad was fresh and ample as a starter. Entree was the meatloaf-good flavor but a bit overcooked for my taste (prefer meat cooked medium not well)...good portion but I couldn't finish it.  I ate too many eggs! Ha! Overall a great experience and I'll be back next time I'm in Charlotte.

sHwZlbNI8vlTjUiLAYwa9w.text: Outstanding!   From the Artichoke for appetizer To the chocolate chip Sunday for dessert!   Everything was amazing!   Had:  Ribs, Kobe sirloin, mixed salad, kale and spinach sauteed.... All were magnificent   Wine- awesome poor! And amazing!   Highly recommend!

E7S7tcz1h49RKS60Kb065Q.text: Love this place! The food, the atmosphere, and great service make it one of my favorite places in Charlotte!

47x3QhqAAcOuv3afdg3z5w.text: Let's start by saying YUM!! I've been here a few times and each time has been delicious!  My first visit to Bricktops was last year during restaurant week and I was hooked! Unlike most restaurant during restaurant week, you can actually choose from any entree on the menu for the $30 price.  The deviled eggs with sugar bacon appetizer changed my life! The sugar bacon is more like candied bacon...sweet, savory, and amazingly delicious! I could come here and only get the sugar bacon. I normally order the New York strip cooked medium which is prepared perfectly each time. The wait staff is friendly and attentive without being annoying.  They lost a start because they're serving flat soda! My last visit I order a coke and sent it back twice. Finally I requested water and told the waitress the coke was flat. She replied with yeah, we've been having issues with that for a while now. For some reason she charged me $2.50 for a flat soda I didn't drink!! The waitress was apologetic about the soda charge and corrected the bill immediately.

83U_cQH7gRvI-fJB7kB58w.text: We had our bachelorette dinner here at Bricktops.  There was a group of 14 of us and they were able to accommodate us with only a days notice for reservation as we had to make unexpected change in plans.  The service was great and everyone really loved their meals. Several got fillets and all said they were great! I can recommend the lobster bisque and the meatloaf. So yummy!

ZuMFpGUJQ_lV6OAd2Ptrbw.text: We went to Bricktop's for lunch and had reservations. We arrived a few minutes late, but we were immediately seated and everyone was very friendly, courteous and quick to accommodate our lunch party.   Service - Definitely 5 stars! The waiters that attended to our table made sure we always had water filled, drinks being served and were very attentive to notice when someone was finishing up with their plate so it was quickly removed from the table. There was no pressure to order appetizers, dessert or anything if we didn't ask about it or want it.  Food - A solid 5! We had the deviled eggs/bacon, the shrimp and the guacamole/chips for our appetizers. All were served very fresh, full of flavor and the portions were perfect for appetizers. For our entrees I had the meatloaf with twice baked potato, another person had the fish tacos with spinach and another had the salmon with creme spinach. All three entrees were definitely a hardy sized portion, our food was delivered in a timely manner and all were cooked properly and full of flavor.  Parking - ZERO! Bricktop's is located across the street from SouthPark mall and in a shopping center beside William's & Sonoma where there was absolutely not enough spaces to accommodate the patrons, no valet service available, small parking spots and a very frustrating experience. Going in for the meal we were frustrated from having to search, wait and then park. Leaving we were frustrated as we tried to rush out of our place so the next person could park, get around cars sitting and waiting for customers in other stores and then simply an overall poor design of the parking lot.  Overall, Bricktop's definitely warrants a solid 4! I will return for the exceptional service, well prepared and great appetizers and entrees, but I will make sure I allow enough time to park over at the mall and then walk over to the restaurant.

pTyFXf0L5aCI6kqd6iJctg.text: Came here after work for a quick bite to eat at the bar with a buddy.  3 things stood out - none of them good.  1.  Don't be different in serving gin & tonic.  Served gin & tonic is a regular water glass, which was taller and narrower than what I'm used to drinking G&T out of--also regular straw dropped right in.  Looked like a sprite with a lime, if you ask me.  2.  Time the food service appropriately.  Enjoying the blue wedge salad for appetizer and didn't really get a chance to finish it because the main course arrived 6 minutes later... they had no awareness or were trying to rush us out of there.  Really disappointing that they tried to actively usher people out of there--more so when we're sitting at the bar.    3.  TUNA AHI BURGER SHOULD NOT BE MADE TUNA SCRAPS.  What a terrible, terrible menu item.  It was not a clean steak of tuna meat, rather, it was a TUNA PATTY.  I can appreciate that it was seared and raw, ONLY IF IT WAS TUNA STEAK.  How are you gonna use the leftover tuna scraps, make it into a patty, and only sear it?  It's very awkward item to eat overall--I'm pretty sure anyone that's had the tuna ahi burger here will not be getting it again.  It's more of a trap, in my opinion, where guests that order it "fell for the trick".    I will not be returning here.  If you are planning on going, then: (1) prepare to eat quickly; and (2) don't order the tuna ahi burger.    dmo out.

LrqJVTBF29i-ORUax_BsGA.text: Solid dinner.  Something for everyone, we always start with the sushi (one cali and one tuna) and end with the cookie (delish).  The kale/quinoa salad is actually delicious and i highly recommend it as a side,  flavorful & refreshing

YEClndsQ5PH4mcI7txUKWg.text: Best kids menu for only $6 with healthy choices like salmon and Mahi and grilled chicken with beautiful sides like broccoli and spinach and other veggies in addition to typical kids choices. The trout with crabmeat and Burre Blanc was fantastic and my husband really enjoyed his prime rib! The service was spectacular and David took fantastic care of us!

rLJZygVRBkmnzLbSFOv8jw.text: It's a little fancy pantsy...Pretentious. White table cloths. However, even though I didn't feel like I fit in much, the food was legit. I had grouper with crab the the lobster bisque was pretty good. I'd go back.

6MLHj4VpeSOUNKpK17a7SQ.text: Went this past Sunday for my wife's birthday. Service was slacking. Meatloaf and mashed potatoes seemed canned. Not restaurant not what I was led to expect.

XIln4O6CYOt5EKcKMB136w.text: Made a reservation for Sunday brunch and went in pretty skeptical judging by some of the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the donuts for appetizer and it turned out the donut machine was having problems which was disappointing BUT the manager came by and said they would bring them to our table as dessert and it was on the house. Now that is the way to handle a restaurant issue. I digress, we ordered the french toast (three huge pieces with delicious caramelized bananas), eggs benedict, and shrimp and grits. They were all incredible. My only complaint is that we had to wait a while for the food but it was well worth it. Delicious meal.

U5szqe13EKVB5tC5tmuS2A.text: This place is great!! My favs are ahi Tuna salad, Cobb  salad, yummy salmon, ribs & beef carpaccio (when available). On Sundays the homemade donuts are a total hit. My fav servers are James & Boggy!!!

BkN9ybUAMjo1qCHDedkHKw.text: First time my wife and I had been to Bricktops...really enjoyed it!  We both had the ribs (they had been recommended) and they were very tender and tasteful.  Had the chocolate chip cookie dessert and it was fabulous!!  Also had the key lime pie but wasn't crazy about it.  The crust was a bit too dry with a strong nut flavor.

CqnG36emii4yYNKF_0aStQ.text: Great lunch and brunch! Delicious coffee, donuts and chicken and waffles.

wKZpAoMjN3Rbp_TCvbU3tw.text: Bricktops Restaurant is a casual eatery located across from the Southpark mall.  I have eaten lunch here on two occasions and both times my meal was pretty good.  My favorite menu items so far are definitely the amazing french fries and the delicious guacamole.  My issues with Bricktops really lie in the details.  First, do I really have to remind you to bring me a straw?   That drives me crazy.  Second, when I order a hamburger medium it should probably come with at least a tiny bit of pink on the inside - not charred all around.  I never send food back, but I was tempted this time!  I actually had to salt my burger - something I have never done before - because there was absolutely no flavor.  I ordered the bleu cheese burger and it came with bleu cheese on the top and caramelized onions on the bottom of the bun.  The onions were overpoweringly sweet and that did not help my poor charred burger taste any better.    However, on the up side... this place is very family friendly, and the entire staff is very nice.  It is the perfect place for a baby shower, a lunch with the girls or a business meeting.  We will definitely go back and hope for a better taste experience next time.

YyeI4V91tl_wc9YLLEj7KA.text: One of my favorites in Charlotte. Try the avacado and crab meat salad, it is a winner. Love the restaurant design, quiet, comfortable and wonderful service. The acoustics are great, allows for nice conversation.  all food items on the menu are excellent.

RorjvBY1ffDhrjxlLS1_qg.text: Brunch was fantastic!  Service was great!  The create your own Bloody Mary is fun.  Will go back again and again!

i_wkbe7fHUoN1EZlMUW5sw.text: Awesome, love the brunch. Fresh ingredients made with skill, great waffles, and eggs benefict! Not to mention there dinners set the same standard. My one complaint is there ahi tuna sandwich is a bit to salty.

vLDREkBmWizgdhPLKBVMpQ.text: Nestled in the great area of Southpark in a small strip of stores near the mall lies Bricktops. This was actually my second visit, but its been probably almost a year since my first.  The atmosphere is great, and the staff always seem to be on top of things. The menu is a tad bit pricey but the food always seems to be worth it.  I had the Parmesan Crusted Chicken which came with rice, and included a side of vegetables, and I got the Cauliflower (which I highly recommend).  Very yummy!!!  Definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner for two or even with a group of friends!!!

g1rjPdQPyzpm8H2l8kau5Q.text: The past 3 times we have visited Bricktop's, service has been terrible!! Food is way overpriced as well.  $16 for chicken fingers???? Seriously?!?  I always get the beef  carpaccio as an entree, but my advice is to save your money and get 3x the amount of carpaccio at Brio right down the street.  Last trip we made here was during the final round of the Masters and the servers/bartenders were more interested in watching tv than offering me another round of my $10 martini. Don't waste your time or money at this place.

eFAl7CCyXjlYr0s-fakurg.text: Went with a friend for my birthday dinner and had a great time.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere.  We had spinach and artichoke dip w/ fresh tortilla chips to start and the real surprise was the fresh and flavorful salsa that came with it...yum!  The margherita flatbread was great for a lighter dinner option with fresh mozzarella and basil.  However, the real standout was the cheeseburger.  It seems they grind the meat for the burger themselves and it proved to be especially juicy and delicious.  The wait staff was friendly, very knowledgeable of the menu and offered great recommendations.  I will definitely go there again!

EtuIq_cxEruw6LIvO50Zow.text: Went last week and now remember why we hadnt been back in a long time.  Went for a birthday party for relatives .  My food was cold when they finally brought it out.  I ask to have it heated and it fianlly came back about the time everyone else was about finished.  NUKED and over done.  GUESS WHO WONT BE GOING BACK.  No offer to comp even after I complained the second time and they could see I wasnt going to eat it.

_KssxgNVSdERyRD-8KNTjg.text: This is one of my local favorites. I am pretty hard to please and 9 out of 10 times they do a great job. I went there for breakfast and they did not have sugar free syrup. The manager ask if I could wait and he would send someone to Harris Teeter after it. I said yes and he did it. I think they should keep it on hand but he sure impressed me with his desire to serve. Great place.

nc1cZ8jZFf9-7VFacjiwhQ.text: Went for mid-week lunch and was impressed how many waitstaff on hand. Host was very friendly. Order put in quickly and food served promptly. Drink refills a little slower than preferred, but everything else very good. Will return!

q1WCpWcT6GBXk9d5SgH_EA.text: I enjoyed the food, especially my fish tacos entree.  The brown rice was inventive and a tasty accompaniment.  The atmosphere was great for a casual date or decent meal after Southpark, especially if you are trying to avoid the chains (Cheesecake, Maggianos, CPK, etc).  Looking forward to trying more things here.

3lad6nNYfQC-UicaC1IIsQ.text: We have been to Bricktops several times.  It is nice, but overpriced.  The service each time has not been impressive, although the food is excellent.  The hostess was flat out rude on one visit.  Had we not been starving, we would have walked out.  Last week we sat on the patio for drinks and apps.  We waited and watched while another party was seated and attended to before us.  We had to go in the bar area and ask for a server.  The place was not crowded whatsoever as it was late afternoon.  Not sure if we will return.

fc9vHyeARiL8-fwrRcV2mQ.text: 3 strikes and out. Tried it 3 times. Food has been mediocre to bad. Way overpriced

g9hgnjskw42yeYV7sWOZZw.text: I eat at Bricktop's quite often and LOVE it! Their chicken sandwich is delish not to mention the deviled eggs.  It is a very nice atmosphere, but still reasonably priced. The patio is also very nice to sit at when the weather is good. Would definitely recommend.

Bs0w05o0Q3ZdvX-pl2SASw.text: Great brunch! I love the smoked salmon app at brunch and the donut holes. Must try! And the carafe of champagne is delish! But don't get a mimosa unless you want lots of pulp in it. Also they have a really cool make your own bloody mary bar!

XXc60RJBe8Q6BZkTfmHBVQ.text: Ok so I first went here when a friend of mine started working here......would've never tried it otherwise. But wow I was surprised how good it was! American food....how boring! But everything I've ever had had been wonderful and my son who is very picky loves It too......and he orders the salmon ....not exactly kid fare and the only place he will eat it! Anyway....awesome martinis with house made infused vodkas. I've had the flat bread,all the salads, and brunch and it is excellent. Service is always spot on and that is hard to come by. A pleasant surprise!

vP_2qRT9-ombqGMKZzT24w.text: While visiting Charlotte, I had lunch on Monday March 20, with my wife and two long time friends. Brick Top's is an upscale restaurant in the South Park area of Charlotte. The ambiance was sleek modern and very tasteful. My wife and I shared a Tempura shrimp. It was very tasty and more than adequate for sharing. We also each had grilled salmon salad. The salmon was well prepared but the salad itself was pedestrian, nothing interesting. All in all a pleasant but not special experience.

o0Ej1Sz3HSY-ZDoCptOBsg.text: Oh, so *this* is where the South Park folks go for Sunday brunch after church.  This was next on our Sunday Brunch series, and we will DEFINITELY be returning. Our server, Mattison (cool name, right?) was sweet and super helpful. The lady and I were persuaded to try out the doughnuts as an appetizer, which were AMAZING. Light, fresh-out-of-the-oven cinnamon sugar dusted mini doughnuts accompanied by chocolate, raspberry, and creme anglaise dipping sauces. Highly recommend to everybody.  I ordered the chicken and waffles, and the lady ordered the crab benedict, which Mattison kindly suggested adding avocado and tomato to.  I really don't want to type too much or else I might start drooling over my keyboard, but the chicken was moist and perfectly fried, the waffle was amazingly fluffy and flavorful by itself, and the lady's crab benedict had massive chunks of real crab with an amazing hollandai--- sorry, can't go on.  The service was awesome, the food was amazing, the portions were huge... after our brunch series is done, this will be somewhere we will be returning over and over again. After all, I've yet to try their deviled eggs... and all of the rest of the menu. Till next time, Bricktop's. You've served us well.

oQTgZBQXFHqU8A25NT9UNQ.text: One of our go-to restaurants.  Great drinks, love the food, especially the kale and quinoa salad, steaks, and the deviled eggs and bacon.

lMP7Y1hdnujjzFqdc1HeOg.text: Bricktops is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! My boyfriend and I go all the time. The atmosphere is great. The staff is always pleasant and extremely helpful. We always look for Rob when we go. He is friendly and knowledgable. He knows his guests and always offers the best recommendations.   I wish I could tell you what to order specifically, but everything is absolutely amazing!! I will share some of my favorites with you.  Appetizers: the deviled eggs and millionaires bacon!! The bacon is thick cut and carmelized with amazing goodness. The smoked salmon is fantastic! I was shocked that it was served warm but this is my current favorite.   Meal: Parmesan Crusted Chicken is my all time favorite dish. The chicken is lightly pan fried with a fantastic lemon butter sauce and capers!!! Bistro chicken is blackened with the same sauce! This is a new favorite. Baby Back Ribs are fall off the bone. I can't share their secret, but they put some extra TLC into these.   Sides: Macaroni & Cheese! I have to have his every single time! Kale & Quinoa Salad is light and delicious. It's served cold which is very refreshing.   Last but not least, you have to order the skillet cookie!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan Crusted Chicken
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Salmon with Kale &amp; Quinoa Salad!!

miQ9o6GsGkEIetDZX8ilhA.text: My food was great! Meatloaf with cream potatoes was delicious. The meat cooked perfectly. But, the server did not give us bread and butter until we asked. Rather disappointed with the services.

lM3iKzc6FCbKuLVeFcpGCA.text: We normally enjoy the food and atmosphere, but this time we left feeling taken for granted. The server was new and well understood. But she dropped the food tray on our table and did got on my 9 year old. Barely a half hearted apology. Cmon

gh7L46trkor2Fv7UyUVY-Q.text: Came for lunch and had a great experience. Service was friendly, and prompt without rushing us.  I had the grilled salmon salad - cooked perfectly, flavorful, nice portion.

UVRg1B9nBtpFCJIC22ljOw.text: Ugh. This is why I don't eat at American restaurants much. The dinner menu (including a separate sushi menu for that matter) offered one meaningful vegetarian choice, a goat cheese flatbread. It was decent, but hardly special, and by no means worth the $15 price. I suppose a lot of restaurants like this exist, and I only go to them when I get pulled in by a group that doesn't share my diet. Nonetheless, I could reasonably hope for better options.  Certainly, the low-light ambiance and the crowded strip-mall parking didn't enhance my opinion of the place either.

8MrfNaygQ479zip39iLuUA.text: My update is LONG overdue.  I have been to Bricktop's so many times since 2012 and I hate that I have not updated my rating.  Needless to say every visit has been extroadinary last night's visit kicked this place to a five star rating in my book. I called ahead and put my name in, for two, and was told 45 to 50 minutes. Upon arrival we checked in and headed for the bar. The bartenders were SO attentive and delivered water while we previewed the drink menu.  Wanting to try something new the bartender gave me her take on a few drinks so I went with the French Martini, vodka, chamboard and pineapple juice...Loved it!  My guest enjoyed a Cabernet. We enjoyed our cocktails and after 35 minutes were seated at a booth table in the bar.  Our waiter arrived and brought water and bread, wish was so warm and fresh, it just started the meal off perfectly.  On this visit I decided to indulge with the Crab Cakes and Mashed Potatoes and was able to also taste the Trout with Lump Crab Meat and Deviled Eggs my date ordered. The deviled eggs, how have I not ordered these before??? The creamy yolk was to die for.  As for the entrees, the trout was cooked too perfection with a creamy butter sause and large lump crab scattered on top. As for the crab cakes, they were too die for. All crab meat with VERY little filler. From the cocktails, service and food Brickop's is not a place to not check out. I look forward to getting back there soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trout with Deviled Eggs
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Dip
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZFXsWJMFLTnfL1elig82Ug.text: My good friend took me out for my birthday today. She loves Brick Top and I have never been - check, check. We went in between lunch and dinner, so no wait.  The restaurant is beautiful. The bar itself is nice sized, and the service es muy bueno.  We had a great server!  We skipped appetizers this go around. But two things caught my eye - the deviled eggs and millionaires bacon, and the goat cheese flatbread - maybe on my next visit.  I had the blackened fish tacos and they were yummy! My friend had the Thai steak salad, I didn't taste it, but it smelled heavenly. And she got the kale and spinach side. It too smelled heavenly and the taste did not disappoint. I will try to recreate that dish for dinner. I think it will spice up my spinach. I noticed the grapefruit rosemary soda. I'm not a fan of grapefruit, but this item made me wish I was. My friend got it, and she loved it. So I have to put my thinking cap on. What fruit can I mix with rosemary infused simple syrup and make into a soda.  I would go again and I would recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos and french fries

3SgkB4ZxELrjg8WS15hc9w.text: Deviled Egg appetizer is to die for! Dover Sole fish entree is littered with bones -- beware!!!! Atmosphere is great -- nice, but not stuffy.  Service is hit and miss. We were there on New Year's Eve and our waitress seemed totally sidetracked although it was only 5:30.

X7o0tLlSnBv2R7dvECGfvw.text: This restaurant is located in the Southpark area and certainly upholds the upscale atmosphere that one would expect. Reservations are not required, but highly recommended if you want a table in a timely manner.  The hostess said that they only reserve part of the restaurant, but based on how busy they were on a Wednesday night, I can imagine that wait times could get lengthy on the weekends.  I ordered a wine on the menu and was disappointed to discover that they did not have this wine, nor had they had it for the past 2 months. There wasn't a comparable substitute so I was left with the option of ordering a different (less preferred wine) or going without- gasp.  Of course, I went with the substitute as this was my first baby-free meal in a month.  I ordered the American Kobe Steak and it was amazing; my husband had the Scottish Salmon and he was also very impressed. Everything was well cooked and came out very fast given how busy the restaurant was. Very nice to be at a restaurant that has it together time wise. The chocolate chip cookie, comes out in a cast iron skillet and is to die for.  Seriously a must have and worth every calorie!  This is definitely an upscale restaurant- all of the staff were in all black, with pearls and red lipstick.  Everyone was very professional but slightly cold.  There was not a lot of personality nor did anyone really engage with us, heck, I would have been thrilled with a smile after the initial greeting.  Overall, the food made up for what the staff is lacking in personality.  We will definitely be back.

JKlyrqFt41RHWgKSeAaCGQ.text: Ahi Tuna was amazing!  Best I've ever had. Great place, my wife and I will certainly be back!

qpAoPegj-K7iHw_hZ8yisA.text: Food was just ok. They forgot to serve our salads first. Everything came to the table at once. Seen a roach on the wall crawling towards me. So gross. Server was very nice. Probably won't return.

VtZ588hHjPUBWYt0s7uCVw.text: At the suggestion of my boss we came here for a lunch with a couple of other coworkers. I had never heard of this place and I've lived in Charlotte my entire life. Anyways after the hostess tried to sit 4 grown adults in a small booth we were seated in the main dining room. That was really the only hiccup of the day.   We arrived around 11:45 before the lunch rush, which if you come after 12:15 expect to wait. I ordered the steak and fries. That was probably the best decision I made all day. The steak was amazing. It had a garlic butter on it, and the steak for lack of a better term was butter. OMG. I picked at my fries, but wanted to save all the room for the steak. M. Steak.   Granted, if I was paying I probably wouldn't have picked the steak. For lunch it is a little pricey, but on the companies' tab I will take it all day.

NE2AvIPT96Hm9wIPHKIHgQ.text: Just outstanding. Great atmosphere. Like a real NY steakhouse with the circular red booths. Great drinks. Friendly staff. Love it. Plan to spend money.

nf68E0pSer7V6ba11vATpQ.text: I love this place. They have the best sushi in Charlotte (hands down) it's always fresh! They don't have a huge selection but you can count on quality ingredients, try the Hollywood or California roll. Just Sit at the bar (If there is room), the bartenders are great and it's more fun! The patio is a nice option too. The dining room tends to be filled with an older snotty crowd, so I avoid it unless I'm with a group. If you like french fries order a side. They are skinny and so good! They have great salads appetizers and entrees. You can't go wrong at bricktops!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hollywood and California roll

kIFyKhF3LjdNJYZD-UxrDQ.text: My friend suggested this as a place to take clients and it exceeded my expectations. The Ahi Tuna burger is fantastic! I've taken a few clients and they've had nothing but glowing reviews. Bricktops is now my go to place!

YANCd8HLGzitpxqB0_rjVA.text: They have sushi and shoestring fries. Enough said. Generous pours, comfortable bar, etc. Did I mention you can have sushi and french fries?!

pbSizJg6JXllwWLOzFzFZA.text: Now THIS was a very pleasant surprise! I don't know why I expected a yucky chain restaurant. This was more "upscale" than I expected. In fact my date thought she was underdressed in her "designer sweatpants" but in reality she wasn't. LOL. I had on my staple shorts and T.....but on the "dressier" side...if that makes sense?  We started with the Deviled Eggs and Sugar Bacon. GOD was that awesome! There was definitely a sugar component to the egg filling, and it matched perfectly with the sugar bacon which was scrumptuous.  We both got a version of their supposedly FRESH Ahi Tuna, which the waitress said was flown in almost daily. Having lived on the West Coast I'm somewhat spoiled in what I expect out of Ahi Tuna. Well this was the real deal....as far as EAST Coast "fresh" Tuna goes. The quality was excellent, and the sear was perfect. Loved those sessame seeds on the oustside. My date's salad was very tasty as well, with the same tuna (albeit smaller in size).  No wine today. Just water. But overall a really excellent dinner experience. I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ahi Tuna salad
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh Ahi Tuna, served perfectly RARE.
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their famous Deviled Eggs and Sugar Bacon. YUM!

HuZWpCsofXRIrPM_wjnEdw.text: Was treated here for Mother's Day. It was horrible from seating, to service, to wine list, to entree'.  It was the worst waste of money spent in a long time!    The seats were outdoor plastic seats on the inside. Uncomfortable for sitting for dinner (ESP in white pants).   Our waitress disappeared halfway thru our meal and never returned. We had to ask the manager standing by the kitchen for refills and the bill.  No one checked on us after our meals were delivered.  And after all the "issues" and "poor service" we received a bill at full price!

gCqljDURqbirGGLhpNI65A.text: Great food and atmosphere. Recommend the grouper for your main course and carrot cake for dessert. Service is very questionable.

lTTQ6p5hmnG_t1oyhJPjOA.text: Awesome Brunch spot in Charlotte!  Amazing chicken & waffles, and their quinoa & kale salad is delish!  The chicken was so tender and fried perfectly.  The grits were even great and I don't like grits usually.  AND...the Bloody Mary bar at brunch was exceptional!  Definitely a great place for a date or to bring a good of friends/family.  They have great superb as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

9L4uOWOZFVbPWrfUr0Vl2A.text: Get the Deviled eggs and the bacon that's on it is to die for!  The service was good, place Is cozy. I'll go back there for the deviled eggs. That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The deviled eggs are to die for!! Maple glazed bacon is unreal.

XUzF5k-ERGKLHie_Vo_7oA.text: I have continued to be impressed with the food and service here.  I would definitely recommend Bricktops.  When I have gone with the kids they were very family friendly which I did not expect!

L4ueDm8P0eW9nAITF8OPtA.text: Ate here for lunch.  Nice interior and service was very good.    Deviled eggs were good but had like a sweetness to them.  Which is weird because the millionaires bacon that comes with the eggs is very sweet and awesome!  The Ahi Tuna salad I had was only okay.  Fish was over cooked and the salad part was soggy.  Didn't have time to deal with sending it back.  I will go back if I'm in the area again but may steer clear of that particular menu item.

Cgrev_RyLe-eT3OEpjDzQA.text: Bricktops is a wonderful restaurant. Their food and service is consistently excellent. The have a warm and cozy ambience. This is s great place for family gatherings, first dates and girls nights out. The price points are very reasonable for the product you receive. Their menu provides a generous variety for the beef and potato lovers to the " I am counting my calories" diner. I have never had a bad dish at Bricktops  This is my go to place to eat when I want to relax, drink and have s great time with friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. They have a great bar with additional booth seating

LmVVJoZGTfQyNFa7FYMRLQ.text: Christmas Dinner outing with my infamous book club, great wait staff. Robert was our waiter. Great food. Large portions. Parking could be a little hectic on a busy evening. Will be back.

ptYAz366sBsnOkFRiNR-7A.text: Good selection, good service, reasonable prices.  Parking less than ideal; probably much better at dinnertime than at lunchtime. Would recommend.

vk_JFWLfd30prC6p_I8Etw.text: Bricktops is a solid go-to for a nice dinner out, but still in a casual setting. The service is always great and the food never disappoints. The wine selection is very good as well. I recommend the prime rib, filet and crab cakes! Can't wait to go back again!

c_wodaD0pFclNkiEq7RFyA.text: Great ambiance! The decor is very nice and romantic. We went for Valentine's day and from the start things were a little sketchy. We had reservations for 2 at 8. We arrived and the hostess seated us, but we passed 9 empty tables before she sat us in the back. As I was seated I realized they had all people of color in this one little section. WTH  The food was good I had grilled lobsters French fries and cole slaw. DO NOT GET THE COLE SLAW. Crab cakes were delicious also.

6s3gNSToAw8DlUT_UoB64g.text: Not the same Bricktops from yesteryear. Tavern burger was floating in grease and extremely over seasoned. Cob salad was good but something in it caused cotton mouth. Drinks were good! Waiter could be best described as pleasantly reluctant to provide top notch service. Probably will not try again for a while.

qLRNpB5Nwa0H7wmPBrsJiQ.text: Service started off well. Food was okay, I ordered the bistro chicken. The sides were tasteless though. I ordered unsweetened tea and only got one glass the next after was sweet. The waiter never came back and when he finally did it was to quickly drop the check. My friend wanted to order something else but the waiter was gone so fast we had no chance. I did not eat much and planned to take the rest home. I looked down after getting my credit card and my plate was gone... okay never mind. Ugh, not planning on coming back.

EgJPprkKExLHWU6d-QXyDQ.text: This place has potential in being good. The flavors were there in the food, but everything I had was a little too salty for my taste. These were the list of food that I had:  Appetizer:  Spinach & Artichoke Dip Guacamole & Salsa Dip  Course: Jumbo Lump Crab Cake  Ahi Tuna Steak

gmhsx1HfQrl4Dyjf21QpzA.text: Steak cooked perfectly. Apps and dinner were both delicious. Next time I'm back in NC, I know where I will be eating !

kanduM8v-Nfy1AEE7uPnkA.text: Tuna was cooked perfectly.  Ribs were fall off the bone, but a little dry. Good slaw.

a0pL6UUbDsoywxn0f_4l1Q.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the area. It's definitely a little more expensive than surrounding places but it's worth every penny!   I have a lot of allergies (shellfish, peanuts, & nuts) and this is one of the few places I am able to eat the fries. They have their own frier and don't share oil with the shellfish. This alone is a huge plus to me. Plus the fries are amazing and perfectly crunchy.    All the food at this place is amazing. I came once when I met up with my old coworkers and another with friends who were visiting. All my friends Saint the place was "on point" and a "great decision". This will definitely be one of my go to places in the future.    The staff was also great and super attentive. I can always tell how good staff is when the manager comes and speaks to me personally about my allergies and to make sure I can eat what I want to order.   Highly recommend to everyone!

Gez9aAJ5SBF0-Ne4Zb_Gjw.text: Amazing place! I went there yesterday without a reservation and the wait were 25min. Food is excellent, nice entrees and great service. If you like fish, you definitely should try the Dove sole meuniere. It was so delicious!!!

K8OldX_diBh1JA0AZHi3lQ.text: I have pasted this restaurant see weak times shopping but I have never stopped. I wasn't sure exactly if it was a pizza restaurant or fine dining but my family finally decided to stop and eat here. We were not disappointed. We were able to get reservations for dinner the same day and did not have to wait long even though we showed up early. We started with the deviled eggs and bacon which I am not a egg fan but they were really good and the bacon was great ! I ordered the Bistro chicken with mash potatoes and spinach. The entree was delicious and the chicken was tender. The only complaint was it seemed to be a little salty for me. My parents had the sea bass and the meatloaf. They both enjoyed both entrees. I think this restaurant will be in our regular rotation !

photos.caption: Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Bricktop's Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bistro chicken

hONRvoU0QMB18A9w8y5BDA.text: This place was lovely and the food was very good. My shrimp and crabmeat salad was so good that I wish the dish would be a bit bigger.. yummy taste though. The service was very good and tables were nicely separated from each other. Loved the ladies room and the artwork there.

eA4XDjIRqFAdQhSitEgMYA.text: We had Japanese earlier in the evening, but I knew that I was going to be hungry again. We were staying across the street and the parking lot was full, so one of these restaurants has to be the draw. We sat at the bar and the bartender was awesome! She even heard me when I told my partner that the drink was too sweet and offered to fix it. I ordered the chicken strips as I didn't want a full dinner. That and I thought everything was a bit pricy. not for the quality of food that is presented to you! The strips were juicy, plump and crispy. But not greasy. And there were 8 huge pieces. the shoestring fries were golden and cooked to perfection. Now the slaw was in a world of it's own. Thinking that this is the best I have ever had. Creamy but not to spicy and crunchy. Yum, yum! Of course when I saw the huge slice of key lime pie my friend had. I had to get my own. (There will be no touching the dogs bowl in this group) The atmosphere was delightful, as well as the service. Great find!

nBTk93i1C__uQ8_-Vdj5_w.text: Bricktops is what I would call upscale affordable.  Service and food quality is very good from reviews I read, but for me only one of two hit the mark for my visit.  It was a Saturday night and insteading of waiting for a table my friend and I decided to eat at the bar.  She had a cheeseburger and I had a ahi tuna salad and a few beers.  Food quality was great, but the service, which was good in the beginning, fell way behind after or initial order.    The bartender got our initial order....by the way I was the only one drinking alcohol...a draft beer, so one could see my glass was empty from a distance............unfortunately the bartenders passed by over and over and over never asking if I wanted a refill.  I eventually got another beer, but by that time dinner was just about completely eaten.  Its a beer folks.....only service can screw that up....and bricktops did just that...at these prices I'll look for other locations close by to give my money to in the future.

ajGkNW3ZxJMoZfSXaaHkKQ.text: We went there on a whim because we were too early for Rooster's brunch. Food was excellent, I had the ABLT and my fiance had creole shrimp, both very fresh and filling. OJ was fresh squeezed and service was super friendly. We will put them on the rotation for Sundays.

DbIXE01jtD3pRtYabybXuw.text: Visited here twice.  Great service both times.  They have some really exceptional entrees. The side dishes were not as stellar but still good. Listen and Listen well..... the BREAD PUDDING is exceptional( the desire to eat it sparked my second visit).  Great alcholic drinks-pricey but strong!

5dTTsRMfa9W0uTfLNcQ7fw.text: First thing you notice walking through the doors is the noise level.  It was very busy on a Saturday night but nonetheless after a long tiresome day, this wasn't my cup of tea.  We even had to ask the waitress to repeat herself several times because we couldn't hear her over the noise.  I am getting older but I don't need a hearing aid yet.  Ordered guacamole appetizer and with first bite a warning signal went off.  There was no taste to the guacamole.  Only a slight taste to the salsa.  The chips were greasy and so we ate very little of a $9 appetizer.  No need to consume considerable fat grams on something with no taste.  My wife ordered chicken.  I ordered salmon.  Just like the appetizer, neither had any taste.  The mushrooms came in a separate bowl swimming in grease and cooked in wine.  The wine taste overpowered the mushrooms unfortunately.  Cost $56 to eat a tasteless meal.  I could have put that money in a jar to save for my hearing aid.  The only positive thing I can say about this restaurant is the service was quite good despite them being very busy.  It is conveniently located across from South Park Mall.  We were so unfulfilled that on the way home we stopped at Cook-Out and got a chargrilled chicken sandwich that had much more flavor than what we ordered here.

XKukMsxvcfdHeZC00laovw.text: The best place in Charlotte. They are consistent with there service and quality of food. Me and my fiance dine here weekly. Never had a bad experience.

3vLHogbBXERddwxlUebqkA.text: Been here a couple times and both times were lunch.  I just recently was turned onto the Palm Springs salad by my all knowing girlfriend and OMG, it was perfect...plain and simple.  I know I will end up burning that dish out because that's how I do but I don't care.  Nothing else on the menu can likely compare.  I do however enjoy their flat bread pizza but this salad is the perfect portion and calorie for me.  Great service and good food takes Bricktop's to The Top of my lunch place spots.

fC_NdjdG42AyW7SBrTmiKw.text: On the way between Sarasota and Cape Cod.  Found BrickTops on Yelp. Really great place with exceptional service. Wife had the prime rib and i had the ahi tuna burger. Food was excellent.  Somewhat  similar to a Houstons. Will stop again next time near Charlotte.  Owners: Need to build one in Sarasota

UH7gSLF_s7aK4FybxAagKA.text: This restaurant is excellent! My husband and I went for restaurant week and we were not disappointed. All of the food was well prepared and presented nicely. I had the lobster bisque soup, artichoke and spinach dip and crab cakes and fries. My husband had the lobster bisque soup as well, sausage flatbread, and ribs. Neither one of is could pin point our favorite because everything was so great. The service was wonderful as well, everyone was friendly and our waiter was very attentive. The restaurant has a nice decor as well. I really like that fact that we were not  rushed with our food. We had time to enjoy dish without the next one being brought out. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back!

XFTdlo3ApkyN4VRrCfhDHg.text: I had high, rooftop hopes for Bricktops but these hopes were flushed away down a porcelain downspout like the meal I had five hours earlier.  Atmosphere - A modern designed room that has maple tables w/ cloth chairs, booths w/ red brick colored leather (or pleather) seats and copper accents throughout.  Service - Service was excellent.  The restaurant was slow and our original server was switched to a new one w/out explanation.  This was kind of odd but we did not ask why as the new server was cheery, helpful and refilled my tea numerous times.   Food - It was early dinner time so I was not looking for a big heavy meal and based on a suggestion from the server I had...da, da, daaaa,...the prime rib sandwich!!  This sandwich seemed like a great decision at the time but later took me to foreclosure and back.  The condemned medium rare misaligned roof meat was stacked high on a fine crusty, buttered and toasted sandwich roll which I dipped its' shingles into a French Onion soup tasting repossession au jus.  For dessert I had the "Chocolate Chip", which was a warm cookie in a skillet w/ vanilla ice-cream.  I determined it was either the meat on the sandwich or the sauce that got me sick as the dessert was shared w/my date and she did not suffer the same torture I went through around 10 PM that night.    Overall - The place left me feeling like a fool because about 4-5 hours later it left me feeling like I had a putty knife in my stomach...and this roof was ready to fall.  Once I evicted what was present I immediately felt relieved.  How do I know this is what got me ill?  Well the last time I ate that day was at 9 AM and it was cereal.  Additionally, I felt immediately better after serving notice on this money pit and then selling it to the porcelain gods.  In the morning I was able to eat without a single lean.    The sad thing is that I initially enjoyed my experience here.  I had excellent service which I tipped very well for and was ready to write a favorable review that was until the sheriff knocked and served notice on my meal.

3eLH_JNe5MF0sKXhFexUyw.text: Very nice spot for both lunch and dinner. Nice atmosphere where one can dress either casual or dressy and feel like they fit in. The staff is great and we've always had good service. Rarely do we have a wait when we go, even on a weekend evening or Sunday brunch. Definitely recommend!

DUaoXxNDaciPqs-Y8XhSCA.text: I've always been a fan of Bricktop's and their food... It wasn't until this past Sunday that I went there for brunch. It was fantastic! The handmade mini donuts were insanely good and the waffle was delicious. Everything seems so fresh here. It's a little pricey but if you're willing to treat yourself definitely check out Bricktop's... Brunch or dinner you can't go wrong!

Je9Ul7_W7wfzC8JC2IQj3g.text: I just want to reiterate how out of this world delicious the Tollhouse Cookie dessert is.  So good that my boyfriend and I must always ask for a knife to cut it down the middle as to avoid any debate on who stole the last bite!  Tears could get involved people...

OwgHTNaq2usG4ytZawEz5g.text: Just got here, still very busy. Our booth still very wet from being cleaned, both seats and table. When hostess was informed, instead of just wiping it down she began to justify the condition by stating it was clean. Had to wait for drink orders. Not impressed with Svc thus far. Martini seemed to lack alcohol & it's $10. Had to wait fairly long for food. When it arrived it was hot and very tasty. Kudos for flavor except for sauteed spinach; garlic overload. My burger while very good was overdone. Our server who was very pleasant comped the burger when he discovered it was not as I ordered. He did so without me requesting it. I will go back, but service really needs to consider the customer more.

G0aj6vHeNzwC3PiB3OZEQg.text: We had a nice meal here tonight. For restaurant week, its 4 courses for $30. I had the caesar salad, sausage flatbread, baby back ribs and bread pudding. Mrs. Dining A had the soup, deviled eggs, crab cakes and ice cream. The ribs, flatbread, deviled eggs and crab cakes were all awesome. Sides of mac n cheese, fries and kale/quinoa were all very good too.  4.5 stars for food. 3 stars for service, which was efficient but rushed. For $30, this is a very very solid deal. We even had quite a bit of leftovers to take home. I'm giving this 5 stars overall though, for the price. It would feel a little pricey outside of restaurant week.

IgRMycHyT2dZZ1-V1VkNxg.text: hello heaven...who knew you were here on earth in the form of fabulous food & perfect corner booth ambiance?   i ventured to bricktops on thursday for a lunch meeting and while the company was good, my main takeaway (as it has been in the past) was feeling impressed with my overall dining experience.  greeted upon arrival by hostess, ushered immediately to our booth, greeted shortly thereof by a server who shared the daily features, drinks delivered & refilled in a timely fashion and finally the food.  i went with the grilled steak salad fresh vine ripe tomatoes, blue cheese crumbles with a vinaigrette dressing - others went with the flatbread,  french fries and even blackened fish tacos - we left feeling comfortably full and satisfied with our meals.  while the variety is good, i still feel like the prices are just a tad too high - but maybe the covers the rest of the experience? this remains on my list of definite go to spots in southpark.

hvbVmASR_NYRsK5BIaajzQ.text: Went the other night with a friend that raved about how good this place was.  The import beer selection was very small.  The beef Carpaccio was just average.  (if you want the best go to Collectors Cafe in Myrtle Beach, you'll be licking the plate). Then I got the Ahi Tuna which was missing something.  I"m not sure if it was the sauce that was throwing it off or what.  The scoop of white rice didnt even look appetizing

CtgxaE9QjX14vjrMRcakKw.text: My fish tacos were pretty good but overpriced for the two small tacos and spoonful of rice. My friend got the crab salad - it was tiny. Our waitress was not the best. She forgot the silverware - even after we got our salads. Had to ask twice for salad dressing. The girl that was filling up water glasses was trying to be cute but was just unbelievably rude. Next time I will go to Firebirds. On the plus side - the place is nicely decorated.

J7lCCmW6cPZFElO5h0FYrw.text: One of my favorites in town for consistently good quality food. Went there Friday for restaurant week with my wife and another couple and we all love it.  The seared scallop on the country ham grits were fantastic. I have gotten the parmesan chicken on several occasions and it's wonderful as well. The deviled eggs are as good as advertised.  Plus the location is cool and comfortable.  A winner.

fSO_pZJ2yDxXuLbELJmW-A.text: The food is always amazing. The Palm Beach Salad is a longtime favorite because it's fresh and consistent. Crab, avocado, red onion, tomato, lettuce. The French dip is the most delicious steak sandwich. This time we had the Margherita Pizza which is thin, crunchy and tasty and the bread pudding is DELICIOUS.
